Speaker: Man 1
Text: You think he’s still breathing?

Speaker: Man 2
Text: I dunno. Why don’t we pull him out and have a look?

Speaker: Man 1
Text: Naw. Let him stew a bit longer.

Speaker: Man 2
Text: What’s this one done, anyway?

Speaker: Man 1
Text: Don’t matter me. Always best not to ask too many questions. Go on, then. Let’s see if he’s ready to make nice.
[We understand that our head, that is, the head of the protagonist was held on water. He is tortured in some kind of prison. He’s being tortured by two soldiers.]

Speaker: Man 1
Text: Wake up, friend!

Speaker: Man 2
Text: We’d about given up the ghost now, didn’t we?

Speaker: Man 1
Text: Fancy another round?
[The protagonist’s head is lowered back into the water.]

Speaker: Man 1
Text: Not so tough now, eh?

Speaker: Man 2
Text: That’s enough, Gav. Let’s get him back to his cell.
[The protagonist is untied and thrown to the floor.]

Speaker: Gavin
Text: I was just getting started.
[He hits the protagonist as hard as he can in the stomach.]

Speaker: Man 2
Text: Not to worry. We’ll come back and have another go later, eh?

Speaker: Gavin
Text: Come on, you. Pick it up.
[They drag him in and throw in the cell.]

Speaker: Man 2
Text: Sweet dreams, mate.
[The protagonist loses consciousness from exhaustion. After some time we can hear the voices outside his cell door again…]

Speaker: Gavin
Text: If you ask me, these bloody convicts are all crazy.

Speaker: Man 2
Text: Wouldn’t know. Haven’t been here long enough.

Speaker: Gavin
Text: Time for your morning bath, milord!

Speaker: Man 2
Text: At this rule, I don’t think he’s going to last much longer.

Speaker: Gavin
Text: Come on, now. Just a few more steps.
[The protagonist is tied back to a stone barrel of water.]

Speaker: Gavin
Text: There. Not so hard, was it? Here we go again. Are you about ready?

Speaker: Man 2
Text: These things take time. Put him back in!

Speaker: Gavin
Text: I can do this all day, mate. Come on, give up your collaborator. It’s that tasty bird, innit? Maybe I can give her go, eh?
[He’s putting the protagonist back in the water.]

Speaker: Gavin
Text: I’m quite enjoying this, are you?
[The protagonist finds the strength to pull out his shackles.]

Speaker: Man 2
Text: Why, you little shit-

[He beats his torturer and kills the second man by stabbing him in the neck with sharp anchoring of his shackles. The first man, Gavin, is drowned in a stone barrel. The protagonist holds his head down with his elbow. Barely moving protagonist leaves the room and hears two guards talking.]

Speaker: Guard 1
Text: When is your next shift?

Speaker: Guard 2
Text: Not until tomorrow. Going to see my wife tonight, if you know what I mean.

Speaker: Guard 1
Text: Did you hear? They are putting that convict through hell. Torturing him day and night for weeks now.

Speaker: Guard 2
Text: And he’s still alive?
[Meanwhile, our protagonist finds a revolver, but there are no bullets in it.]

Speaker: Protagonist
Text: Just my luck…
[He breaks the bars on the window and goes into the other room. He is noticed by a guard.]

Speaker: Guard
Text: Who goes there?

[The guard’s attention switches to some evil creature that other soldiers are fighting against. Our protagonist takes advantage of the opportunity to leave. In the next room, he encounters a soldier coming out of… an elevator and threaten him with his empty revolver.]

Speaker: Protagonist
Text: Hands up!

Speaker: Soldier
Text: Alright, mate.

Speaker: Protagonist
Text: Not a word. Inside. Close them.
[The elevator’s starting to go upstairs.]

Speaker: Soldier
Text: Let’s just talk this through, shall we? You’re him, aren’t you? You’re the convict everyone’s talking about. There’s only one way out of here. Walking dead, that’s what you are. Gonna wish you’d never left them catacombs.

Speaker: Protagonist
Text: Shut your mouth.

Speaker: Soldier
Text: Fair enough, fair enough. It’s your funeral, not mine.
[The elevator stops.]

Speaker: Protagonist
Text: Move!

Speaker: Soldier 2
Text: Stay sharp! The convict could be anywhere. He’s already killed two of our men.

Speaker: Soldier 3
Text: That’s why we have our orders. Shoot on sight.

Speaker: Soldier
Text: He has a gun! He has a gun!

Speaker: Soldier 3
Text: We have orders to open fire! Take him down!

Speaker: Soldier
Text: Whoa, fellas, whoa!
[They’re shot the soldier. When he falls, he pushes the protagonist back into the elevator.]

Speaker: Soldier 3
Text: They’re heading up! Let everyone know where he’s headed!

[In the elevator they begin to fight for the gun. The soldier succeeds in defeating the weakened protagonist and pulls the weapon out of his hands. The soldier pulls the trigger immediately, but the revolver is empty.]

Speaker: Soldier
Text: What?
[A protagonist attacks a soldier. A naturalistic bloody fight begins, at the end of which the protagonist takes the soldier into a grip and breaks his neck. We hear a gunshot.]

Speaker: A soldier with a French accent
Text: Give yourself up, monsieur! My next shot will not be a warning!

Speaker: Soldier 2
Text: Up here! We heard a gunshot!

Speaker: Soldier 3
Text: Hurry! This way! This way!

Speaker: Soldier 2
Text: Follow me!
[Suddenly a soldier with a French accent lowers his weapon. The protagonist keeps running and gets to the roof.]

Speaker: Soldier 3
Text: Up on the roof!

Speaker: Soldier 2
Text: Hands where I can see them!

Speaker: Old man
Text: The play is over, Galahad. Surrender yourself.
[The protagonist is surrounded on both sides. He has nowhere to run.]

Speaker: Soldier 2
Text: Raise your hands, now!

Speaker: A soldier with a French accent
Text: Raise your hands!

Speaker: Soldier 2
Text: Hands up!

Speaker: Soldier with a rifle
Text: Gray!

Speaker: Woman
Text: Don’t do this!

Speaker: Old man
Text: I said, surrender!

Speaker: Soldier 2
Text: Hands on your head!

Speaker: Old man
Text: You have betrayed our Order. No one may escape the penalty.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: You forget, Lord Chancellor. I’m as good as dead already.
[He’s jumping from the roof to the river below.]

Speaker: Woman
Text: Galahad!
[We’re being thrown back in time. Galahad enters the roof of some building.]

Speaker: Radio
Text: Galahad, come in. Galahad, acknowledge. This is Command.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: I read you, Perceval.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Enjoying a stroll in the park, are we?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Nothing quite like a chilly London morning to stimulate the senses.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Not to interrupt your little constitutional, but we have confirmation of multiple marks at Grosvenor Square.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: What are our directives?

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Rendezvous at the United India House with Igraine and Lafayette and contain the threat. Do you have it in sight?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Right in front of me.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Good. Assess the situation once there and proceed with caution. Did Nikola provide you with armament?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Yes. Essex M2 Falchion.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Good, the Falchion’s secondary ordnance should help. We may be pursuing bedlamites, but they remain civilians. Use non-lethal force whenever possible.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Understood. Are you joining us?

Speaker: Perceval
Text: I have a small matter to attend to. I’ll find you afterwards.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: En route now. Galahad out.
[He goes down from the roof to the residential area of the building.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: I’m on my way down to the street.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Acknowledge.
[When he goes out on the balcony he hears someone’s voice. It could be one of his colleagues.]

Speaker: Constable
Text: Ladies and gentlemen, we kindly request that you proceed as indicated by the officers in charge.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Galahad, Igraine, any word from Lafayette?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Negative.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Same here… He’s probably off somewhere gallivanting. Being… well, himself.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: I know your concerns, but trust me, he’s a good lad.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: If you say so. In any case, I have no time to look for him. I’m assigning the last few constables to their posts.
[Walking through the dirty streets of old London, Galahad meets Igraine.]

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Galahad! See that you cordon off the entire district. And do it quietly. How did you arrive here so quickly?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Skill, love.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: I must admit, you do move fast for a man of your age.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: No knight cares to be reminded of his decrepitude by a fair damsel.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: My lord, this damsel would never be so callous as to do such thing.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Sure, Isi. Would you ever.
[Igraine laughs.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Who are the marks?

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Bedlamites running amok. Perceval thinks it could be a rebel subterfuge. Let’s hope you haven’t lost your edge.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Remember who trained you.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: He was the best. In his day.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Was?

Speaker: Igraine
Text: You’re still pretty good. But I’m better.
[She nods to the constable guarding the locked gate.]

Speaker: Constable
Text: Yes, Ma’am.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Igraine. Come in.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Acknowledge, Perceval.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Multiple escapees spotted the East Entrance of the United India Underground station. Intercept with caution.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Understood. Come on, Gray. Let’s move.
[She’s approaching the gate to the underground station.]

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Once we’re inside don’t let anyone else through.

Speaker: Mercenary
Text: Sure you don’t need help, love?

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Do you mean a strong man to take control of things?

Speaker: Mercenary
Text: That’s right.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Just stay out of our way. I’d hate for you to get shot by mistake.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Trouble?

Speaker: Igraine
Text: The usual trigger-happy mercenaries.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: The United India Company prefers its minions enthusiastic.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: The last thing we need is a band of hired guns causing more havoc. I’ve told them to remain on lockdown.
[They go inside. Scared people are running out of the lobby. Igraine sees some mental institution escapee take possession of a constable’s weapon and kill him. She bosses more experienced Galahad.]

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Galahad, take cover! Come on! Come on! Let’s get to work!

Speaker: Psycho
Text: You can’t hit me! Fuck off, you!
[Galahad shoots the scumbag in the head.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: We’re clear.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Move up!
[Around the corner, they face a real riot and a whole bunch of psychos.]

Speaker: Psycho
Text: Get out of here. Find some weapons. You two. Get you arses over here. I need help! Come on.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Go.

Speaker: Psycho
Text: Let’s go, you bloody bastards!

Speaker: Igraine
Text: A rifle will be more appropriate…

Speaker: Psycho
Text: Kill ’em both!

Speaker: Igraine
Text: More escapees, coming from the alley!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Some are heading for the atrium!

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Street clear! There are more in the courtyard!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Atop the stairs!

Speaker: Psycho
Text: I swear, I’ll blast his head into goddamn mash!

Speaker: Hostage
Text: Help!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Dammit… There could be more in the atrium!

Speaker: Igraine
Text: We should move in! They’ve locked the door. I can hear more commotion inside. Hurry, more bedlamnites inside!
[Galahad breaks down the door with his shoulder and takes the hostage off guard.]

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Back away! He’s stunned! Take the shot!
[Galahad shoots the psycho in the head with his rifle.]

Speaker: Hostage
Text: Ah, thank god.
[Igraine gets a bullet in the shoulder.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Isi! Are you all right?

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Damn it!
[She drinks Black Water from a pendant around her neck.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Oh god. They’re slaughtering them. You ready?

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Let’s get rid of this scum. Smoke grenades.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Right. (throws a couple]

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Alright. Let’s go.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: There were more on the level above! We need to get up there!
[Having killed the psychos on the ground floor, they enter the elevator.]

Speaker: Igraine
Text: We should clear the second floor. Everything to your liking thus far?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Quite. Just another ordinary London morning.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Indeed.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Although I do hope that was only the beginning. Ladies first.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Quiet!

Speaker: Psycho
Text: What do you reckon, mate? You think we’ll get to shoot a few of them rich folk? Huh? Say no more. I’ll take that as a yes.
[Galahad breaks the neck of the first psycho, and Igraine breaks the neck of the second.]

Speaker: Psycho
Text: Where did you come from!? Get those bloody coppers!
[They run into two armed constables.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: You two.

Speaker: Constable
Text: Sir!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Downstairs. There are civilians who need your assistance.

Speaker: Constable
Text: Yes sir! Sir, General Lafayette is in the next room.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Is there a single woman in this city he won’t try to seduce? He’s your problem now. Do try not to lag behind.
[She leaves.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Lafayette.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Ah, monsieur. This lady requires my attention.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Marquis! Your attention is required elsewhere!

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: I assure you, mademoiselle, that only the vow of fidelity prevents me from accepting your invitation.

Speaker: Lady
Text: Oh Marquis! You mustn’t leave now!

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Unfortunately, my lady, my duty compels me elsewhere.
[He kisses her hand and he’s running after Galahad.]

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Most fetching, was she not?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: I hadn’t noticed.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: That is because you are not a Frenchman.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: You are the most American Frenchman I have ever known.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: I am a lover of liberty, mon ami.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: A proper knight must learn to curb his passions.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Without passion, monsieur, a man cannot fight.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: We do not fight men, Marquis.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Men, Half-Breeds. What does it matter? Vive la liberté!
[Lafayette’s leaving. Galahad notices two men talking in the distance.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Perceval? Strange… Let’s go.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: It’s about time.
[They go down the escalator to the Mayfair underground station.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Marquis, you and Lady Igraine take that entrance. I’ll go through this one and sweep for any remaining escapees.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Oui monsieur!

Speaker: Radio
Text: Air Command to all Knights in the vicinity of Mayfair: the Metropolitan Police has finished cordoning off the affected areas, Sentinels are continuing their overhead sweep; we will alert you to any sightings of the escaped patients.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Acknowledge!
[Galahad hears voices from somewhere far away.]

Speaker: Constable Wickes
Text: Oi, Miller! You have to see this.

Speaker: Constable Miller
Text: Wickes, I am not moving from my position. We have our orders.

Speaker: Constable Wickes
Text: My goodness! How could this have happened?

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Galahad, are you making any headway?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: I’m in the generator room.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Lafayette and I have decided to split our search.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Oui mademoiselle, but I have not met any resistance yet.
[Galahad sees Igraine at the other end of the tunnel.]

Speaker: Igraine
Text: I had a feeling I’d beat you here… youth always prevails…

[Searching the dark corridors of the underground station, Galahad stumbles upon one of the lunatics, but he is in no hurry to attack. Instead, she begins to slowly and eerily transform herself into a huge Lycan.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Everyone! One of our escapees is a Half-Breed.
[Lycan’s running away. Galahad hears a howl in the distance.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Make that more than one.
[After a diversionary maneuver, the Lycan attacks Galahad.]

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Mademoiselle, are you near his location?

Speaker: Igraine
Text: My route is blocked. It may take me some time to reach him! Confirmed mark on my side!

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Monsieur, hold on! I’m almost there!
[But when they manage to get to Galahad, the fight is over. He runs after the creature.]

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Monsieur!

Speaker: Igraine
Text: What happened?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: I slew most of them. The last one got away. Igraine, I need your Arc Gun. I’ll head up to street level and keep after him. You two go that way and head him off.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Understood!
[Galahad picks up the TS-23 electric rifle and goes up the stairs to the surface. The Lycan, meanwhile, is already wreaking havoc.]

Speaker: Man
Text: Look out! Half-Breed! Please, god! Keep us safe!

Speaker: Igraine
Text: We need to press forward! Out of the way!
[Galahad kills a Lycan with a precision shot from electric rifle.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Everyone alright?

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Yes.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Perceval. We’ve neutralized the threat on our side.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Good. I managed to capture one of the Half-Breeds. Rendezvous back at Regent Street.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Acknowledge. Let’s go.
[Perceval throws two constables of a bound Lycan who has not had time to transform.]

Speaker: Constable
Text: Sir? What should we do with him?

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Westminster. To the catacombs. We’ll deal with him later.

Speaker: Commissioner Doyle
Text: Ah. Sir Perceval. I thought the Order of Her Majesty’s Royal Knights might be mixed up in this affray.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: We had reason to suspect a Rebel incursion, Commissioner.

Speaker: Commissioner Doyle
Text: An elementary conjecture. In that event, perhaps this might be of interest.
[He gives him a small leather bracelet.]

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Whitechapel.

Speaker: Commissioner Doyle
Text: Purely circumstantial, of course.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: I call it evidence.

Speaker: Commissioner Doyle
Text: Well, circumstantial evidence can be a tricky animal, my dear Sir Perceval. You may think it is pointing at one thing, but shift your point of view slightly, and you may find it pointing in an equally-uncompromising manner at something entirely different.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Please, indulge me with your musings, Commissioner.

Speaker: Commissioner Doyle
Text: Well, first the Rebellion, and then this Jack and the Ripper murders. And then, this. Strange, don’t you think, that Whitechapel has become the epicentre of our recent conundrums? We must examine every clue now, you see.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: We meet in council two days hence. If you would do us the honour of presenting your findings-

Speaker: Commissioner Doyle
Text: You can expect me at Westminster.

Speaker: Constable
Text: Over here, sir.

Speaker: Commissioner Doyle
Text: Do excuse me.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Where have you been?

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Bloody London traffic.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Mon general, what of the other Half-Breeds that escaped through Hyde Pack? We must pursue them!

Speaker: Perceval
Text: No.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: But, our duty is to continue, sir!

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Marquis, we do not hunt the English in the New World! Your boldness will be required a more convenient time.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Yes, my general.  I will be governed by your advice.

Speaker: Commissioner Doyle
Text: Sir Perceval! I’m sure you will appreciate that, for the time being, this must remain a police matter.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Of course.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Something’s amiss. The underworld in Whitechapel is known to give safe harbour to the Rebellion.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Precisely what troubles me.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: And why would so many Half-Breeds be found in Bedlam?

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Some things we need to find out for ourselves.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: You heard Commissioner Doyle. It’s a police investigation now.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Knights do not relinquish their authority to bureaucrats.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Perceval is right. This matter should be brought before the council.
[The scene changes to the Round Table meeting.]

Speaker: Lord Chancellor
Text: …centuries have passed, but our order has remained steadfast in its sacred mission to preserve the balance between man and Half-Breed. Such was the quest of our founder, King Arthur, may his name be forever resplendent.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Is it true? Did the Lord Chancellor fight by Arthur’s side?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: That is the legend.

Speaker: Lord Chancellor
Text: Today that balance is threatened with grave upset by a new contagion. The Rebellion. As long as it campaign of anarchy and terror is allowed to continue, the plague of Lycan infestation that has infected our city will only grow more intolerable.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: The Lord Chancellor will thus agree to the urgency of a mission into Whitechapel.

Speaker: Lord Chancellor
Text: Whitechapel is a matter for the civil authorities.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: When the noble Arthur sought to contest for truage with the Roman emperor Lucius, he did not trouble himself with issues of jurisdiction.

Speaker: Lord Chancellor
Text: Do not presume to quote history to me, Sir Perceval. I’ve seen more of history than you shall ever know. I remind the knights here assembled that the threat to this order comes not only from without, but within. We must stand vigilant together, lest our ranks be poisoned by those who seek the destruction of all we hold sacred. No one is immune from the rebels influence.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Surely the Lord Chancellor does not mean to question Sir Perceval’s loyalty.

Speaker: Lord Chancellor
Text: This order has long appreciated Sir Perceval’s counsel. But the current disruption calls for caution and concerted effort, not rush action.

Speaker: Lord Darwin
Text: Sir Perceval has cause, Lord Chancellor. The situation in Whitechapel may need to be adressed.

Speaker: Lord Chancellor
Text: Does Lord Darwin speak with the blessing of the peers? Lord Hastings, Lord Dunglass?

Speaker: Lord
Text: He does, Lord Chancellor. Perhaps the question should be put to the council.

Speaker: Lord Chancellor
Text: Very well. What says the Order of Her Majesty’s Royal Knights in the matter of Whitechapel? "Aye," or "nay"?
[Aye! and Nay is heard.]

Speaker: Lord Chancellor
Text: The Nay’s have it. This Council is dismissed.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Our order grows too prudent, Grayson. We wither away from this inaction.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Leave it, Sebastien.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Sir Perceval is most agitated.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: You should learn it is best not to cross him when his mind is set on something.
[In the lobby, Perceval is talking to Nikola Tesla.]

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Galahad will deal with this in due time. I have a more pressing matter to attend.

Speaker: Tesla
Text: As you wish.

Speaker: Sir in a White Wig
Text: How many are making the journey to America?

Speaker: Lord Hastings
Text: Lord Barrett, Lord Darwin, and myself.

Speaker: Sir in a White Wig
Text: I heard great many things about the Agamemnon, Lord Hastings.

Speaker: Lord Hastings
Text: She is the finest the United India Company has ever built. I can promise you a pleasant – and speedy – journey across the Atlantic.

Speaker: Sir in a White Wig
Text: Can we expect your presence at the launch, Sir Lucan?

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Would be my honour to see you off on your maiden voyage, my lords.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Sir Lucan, if I may.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: If you will permit me, my lords.

Speaker: Sir in a White Wig
Text: Of course, Sir Perceval.
[He and Sir Hastings leaves them alone.]

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Alastair, you know as well as I do that Whitechapel is the key to these disturbances. To everything.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: My opinion is immaterial. The council has spoken.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Few dared countermand your father’s express wishes.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Need I remind you that we all serve at the Lord Chancellor’s pleasure…

Speaker: Perceval
Text: You are the Knight Commander!
[Realizing it’s out of line with propriety, Perceval lowers its tone.]

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Make him see reason.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: You think an incursion into a rebel stronghold is reasonable.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: I consider it an acceptable risk.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: One for which you’d be willing to accept full responsibility should… unforeseen circumstances arise.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Let what befalls be upon my head. No one else’s.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Whitechapel remains off-limits. That is - officially.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: You have my thanks, Sir Lucan.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Of your thanks I have no need. Bring me results.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: As the Knight Commander wishes.
[He goes to Galahad and the others.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Well?

Speaker: Perceval
Text: We’re going in.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Most excellent!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: When do we move?

Speaker: Igraine
Text: You’re not talking about Whitechapel? But my father-

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Your brother sought fit to permit us a reconnaissance. Secure the necessary materials. Isabeau, a word.
[Perceval and Igraine leaves.]

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Tell me, Monsieur. About the Lord Chancellor.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: What is it, Marquis?

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Sir Lucan and Lady Igraine were adopted by him, yes?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: They were.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Why would he bring them into such struggle?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Perhaps he wanted to regain a semblance of the humanity he lost. When time came to join the Order…. the choice was theirs to make.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Regardless. I would not wish this life on my children.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Marquis! We need to hurry.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Oui mon general! Avec plaisir! Monsieur.
[He’s leaving. Sir Lucan is approaching Galahad.]

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Friend Malory has always been something of a rogue operative.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: I’ve never known a better man.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Still, I shall rely on you to be a… call it a sobering influence.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Sebastien and I have long been partners. I trust him with my life.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: A little restraint would not be ill-advised. Do look after my sister… won’t you?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: No man in the realm can keep Isabeau from danger when she’s of a mind.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: You say true. What’s a brother to do, eh? Good luck and godspeed.

Speaker: Tesla
Text: Always at your service, Sir Galahad. This way, please.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Ah. Tesla. Just the man. What new developments do you have to show me?

Speaker: Tesla
Text: Quite a few intriguing things, if I may say so.
[They go down by elevator to Nikola Tesla’s workshop.]

Speaker: Tesla
Text: Any further news of the trouble in Grosvenor Square?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: The police are investigating. And investigating

Speaker: Tesla
Text: Lycans on the United India Company’s front doorstep. What do you make of it?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Mayfair isn’t what it used to be.

Speaker: Tesla
Text: Permit me to oversee a few of my new experiments. Uh, in the meanwhile, take a look around. Uh, play with whatever strikes your fancy. But do be careful.
[Galahad finds the poster for the meeting between Edison and Tesla. A picture of Edison is drawn in a way that makes him look like a devil.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Nikola, how fares your friend Edison these days?

Speaker: Tesla
Text: Thomas and I not on speaking terms… The man is an idiot!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Quite an antique. Hard to believe we ever used these communicators.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: All gibberish to me.

Speaker: Tesla
Text: Sir Galahad. Here is something you may find interesting. This device allows you to convert between Edison’s inefficient direct current and my superior alternating current. Quite handy for overloading and incapacitating certain electrical systems. It’s comprised of an inverter, transformer and rectifier, outfitted with some brass clips to enhance the design. Oh, and a fine leather carrying case. Inside each tube is a small quantity of mercury. When the mercury is properly aligned, the device becomes operational. Please, try it. Ah, excellent.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: You never cease to amaze, Nikola.

Speaker: Tesla
Text: I’d appreciate your expert opinion on my latest whimsy. Here.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Essex 84 Marksman Carbine. Impressive.

Speaker: Tesla
Text: You’ve always had a good eye for craftsmanship. I’ve outfitted this one with a telescopic sight. It’s ideal for long-range shooting. I would be honoured if you would test its efficacy.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: With pleasure. Recoil is sharp, but manageable. Some muffing might be in order as well.

Speaker: Tesla
Text: I’ll attend to it immediately. So, are there any other of my children that you would like to meet?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: The offer’s tempting, but I must return to the others.

Speaker: Tesla
Text: Of course. Oh, the monocular that General Lafayette requested in over there, on the table.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: I’ll see that he gets it.
[He gives Lafayette the binoculars… during the Whitechapel raid. Sitting in the carriage, Perceval briefs his collegues.]

Speaker: Perceval
Text: We scour the district in pairs. Isabeau, you and Lafayette take the High Street from the south end. Galahad and I will move in from the north.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Why not give the Frenchman to Galahad?

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Mademoiselle doubts my intentions. I promise to remain at all times the picture of chivalry.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: I’d prefer to have someone more experienced looking out for me.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: I thought you needed no looking after.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Very well. You team with Galahad.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Mademoiselle will perhaps one day allow me to demonstrate my… skill.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: One day.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Remember, we are entering rebel territory. The insurgents will take umbrage at our incursion into Whitechapel.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Given our little discovery in Mayfair, the London Hospital should be our target.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Strange to think Lycans would find sanctuary here, is it not, monsieur?

Speaker: Igraine
Text: You really believe the Rebels are collaborating with the Half-Breeds?

Speaker: Perceval
Text: The Lord Chancellor is convinced of it. I have my doubts.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Do you trust anyone, mon general?

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Never accept, always question. It’s a motto that’s seen me through the centuries. Stay vigilant, all of you. We can expect hot work here.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Ah… what joy!
[They start exploring the dark streets of Whitechapel at night.]

Speaker: Perceval
Text: A nest of cutpurses, collaborators, and whoremongers. I knew it very differently, once. A lone chapel stood just there, offering sanctuary to travellers.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: That was before even my time. The city walls had yet to come up.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Now, you can smell Whitechapel before you see it.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Nothing is as it used to be, Sebastien.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: True. The Order least of all.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: We rendezvous at the hospital. Stay on your guard.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Understood.
[They’re splitting up.]

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: This way, monsieur.
[Galahad and Lafayette enter a house.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: The ashes are still warm.

Speaker: Whore 1
Text: Hello there, boys!

Speaker: Whore 2
Text: Join us, won’t you?

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: And look, Monsieur! Those lovely ladies on the balcony arc waving a us!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Prostitutes, Marquis.

[Soon they see a criminal standing with his back to them and decide to gently eliminate him with a little trick. Lafayette hides behind a wooden fence and Galahad throws an apple at the criminal. When the criminal turns around, Lafayette strips him of his consciousness with a suffocating grip.]

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Oi!
[Galahad asks a civilian to remain silent and throws him a coin. He sees two bastards beating some poor guy.]

Speaker: Criminal
Text: That’s it, Kev! Tear him apart! Come on! Knock the stuffing out of him! Go on, Kev! Finish the bastard!

Speaker: Kev
Text: You want more?

Speaker: Criminal
Text: He’s bleedin’ like a stuck pig, that one!

Speaker: Kev
Text: Doesn’t look good. He ain’t getting up.

Speaker: Criminal
Text: Stay down, you stupid git.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Strange place…
[They go out into the square, where a man from the podium agitates people to fight against the wealthy lords.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: We’ve been spotted, let’s move.

Speaker: Scared Woman
Text: I don’t know! I swear! I only caught a glimpse of him.

Speaker: Angry Man
Text: She’s dead because of you!
[He hits the woman, and Galahad hits him.]

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Well done, sir!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Didn’t care to dirty your aristocratic hands?  It’s alright. There’s no need to be afraid.

Speaker: Scared Woman
Text: How could I have known he was the Ripper? He was just another bloke!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: He killed another one last night?

Speaker: Scared Woman
Text: I didn’t know!

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Leave her be, monsieur. She’s in shock.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Don’t worry, you’re safe now. We should head through this door…
[He breaks into the door with a futuristic device and they enter a small tidy bar Aux Belles Muses.]

Speaker: Barkeeper
Text: Oi! There’s no weapons allowed in the establishment. You want to stay? You leave it here.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Bien sur, monsieur! As a matter of fact, we were just looking for the coat closet.
[He smiles and gives him his gun.]

Speaker: Barkeeper
Text: Give it here.
[Galahad do the same.]

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: At ease, monsieur. A quick reconnaissance of the premises seems imperative.
[He runs straight to the whores.]

Speaker: Whore
Text: Isn’t he a cute one?

Speaker: Whore 2
Text: Mind, you keep your hands off. I saw him first.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Ladies, please. Lafayette is happy to share his favours.

Speaker: Whore 1
Text: Aren’t you the checky one?

Speaker: Whore 2
Text: You’re French, aren’t you?

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Is it that obvious? Tell me the truth. It was the nose, wasn’t it?
[Meanwhile, Galahad is busy working. He’s looking at someone’s wallet. ]

Speaker: Whore 1
Text: And such a nice one you’ve got. You know what they say about big noses.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: That’s feet.

Speaker: Whore 2
Text: Noses, too.

Speaker: Whore 1
Text: Don’t get many Frenchmen around here. I’ll be you’re a soldier. No, an officer.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Major General Lafayette, veteran of the American army, at your service.

Speaker: Whore 1
Text: Fancy that. An American! I bet you got lots of stories to tell

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: I prefer action to talking.

Speaker: Whore 2
Text: Well, what are we waiting for?

Speaker: Whore 1
Text: Isn’t he a cute one?
[Several rebels enter the bar.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Marquis, this is no time for sport. We have to find a way out of here. Quickly.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: I have just the thing, monsieur. If one of you ladies would reach into my pocket-
[One of the whores take out a hefty sack of gold coins.]

Speaker: Barkeeper
Text: Give it ‘ere, love.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Is it sufficient, monsieur?

Speaker: Whore 2
Text: More than sufficient, I’d say!

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Upstairs, then, if you please.

Speaker: Whore 1
Text: This way, love.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Get in here!
[Galahad pushes Lafayette into one of the rooms.]

Speaker: Whore 1
Text: Oi! Hey! What are you up to? You’re in the wrong room!

Speaker: Barkeeper
Text: Where’s that little frog gone?

Speaker: Whore 1
Text: He’s in there. With his friend!

Speaker: Barkeeper
Text: Oi! Get out of there!
[Galahad and Lafayette notice that the room is already… in use.]

Speaker: Whore 3
Text: Oh? Hello…
[A man who uses a whore runs for his gun. Galahad stops him.]

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Apologies, madame.
[They take the weapons and go out onto the balcony and climb up to the roof of the next house.]

Speaker: Woman Rebel
Text: We have intruders. Get your weapons, let’s go!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Lafayette, shhhhh… Looks like we’ve stirred the nest… Keep a look out, Marquis. I need to find a way through here.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: I shall be diligent, Monsieur.

Speaker: Rebel 1
Text: Did you hear that whistle?

Speaker: Rebel 2
Text: We best keep our eyes open…

Speaker: Rebel 1
Text: Aye… two shorts for bobbies, one long for Knights.

Speaker: Rebel 1
Text: Damn… Knights… you sure it’s not the other way ’round? Ya know, two shorts for Knights, and one long for bobbies?
[Galahad shoots them in the head.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Clear!

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Perhaps the rooftops are not our best path, monsieur…

Speaker: Galahad
Text: You may be right. We need to find another way to the hospital.
[They’re getting their gear back.]

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: I found a way out.

Speaker: Man
Text: Oh god, the Black Coats are here!

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Too easy.  I sense that we are not welcome here…

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Keep your eyes open. We don’t want to create any further commotion.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Look monsieur God did not save this queen…
[A sniper shoots at them, but misses.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Move! Lafayette, keep your head down! We need to take out the sniper!

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Absolutely, sir.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Lafayette, take the street!

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Yes! Look out! Up on the landing!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: We have to keep moving… I imagine more rebels are on their way.

Speaker: Rebel
Text: Hey! Help me move the cart! We need to slow them!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: They’ve blocked the way!

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Through the building! More Rebels, in the courtyard!

Speaker: Rebel
Text: Fuck! The Knights have made it through!

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Monsieur! Shotgunner, coming out of the building!
[Galahad shot a red barrel.]

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Holy shit!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: That did some damage.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: This is most exciting! Monsieur! Grenadies!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Understood, Marquis.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: I believe the Rebels are out of reinforcements, Monsieur. We are almost through!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: We need to keep moving and get off of the streets.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: A little help with the wagon, monsieur?
[They pull the cart back and go back up to the roofs.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Perceval, do you read me?

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Save your breath, monsieur. The building are blocking the signal.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: The curse of progress. Hand me your monocular. I can see our target. The Hospital is two miles west.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Do you see our comrades?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: The overhead rail tracks seem to have collapsed here. There! It must be them.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Shall we join the soirée?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Let’s invite a few friends, shall we? Air Command, this is Galahad. I need response from anyone in the vicinity of Whitechapel. Air Command, this is Galahad. Do you copy?

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Think, monsieur. We are without sanction here. The Lord Chancellor will be most displeased. Lafayette does not fancy a court-martial.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: We’ll worry about that later.

Speaker: Radio
Text: Sir Galahad, this is Sentinel 5. We are three leagues northeast of Whitechapel. Please state directives.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Sentinel Five, this is Galahad. We require air support on standby.

Speaker: Radio
Text: Acknowledge, Sir Galahad. We are signalling blue, red at a one second interval. We request your visual confirmation for healing change. Sir Galahad, this is Sentinel 5. We have visual confirmation of your position. Heading change to two-two-four degrees. Assuming holding pattern above Whitechapel in eight minutes.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Acknowledge, Sentinel 5. Await further orders at location.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Let’s go. Ah, the smell of pestilence.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Your Parisian slums are more fragrant, I suppose.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Shit smells like shit, monsieur. Anywhere in the world.  Oh damn.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Lafayette!

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Not to worry, monsieur. I’m alright. Would not our time be better spent hunting Half-Breeds?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Patience, Marquis.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: This word again. "Patience," always "patience."
[They manage to get to the rear of the rebels.]

Speaker: Rebel 1
Text: Leave that, Jimmy, get going. Come on, I’ll cover our bases.

Speaker: Rebel 2
Text: Yes sir!

Speaker: Rebel 1
Text: Come on, let’s go!
[Galahad looks at Lafayette and shoots the rebel in the head.]

Speaker: Rebel 2
Text: Shit! Behind us!

Speaker: Constable
Text: Help! I’m pinned down!

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: My friend! The constable needs our help!
[Galahad rushes to power and in hand-to-hand combat defeats two rebels, but the third takes the hero by surprise. Perceval eliminates him.]

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Stop for a pint, did you?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: We encountered some resistance.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: The rebels are better armed than we expected. Those markings look familiar?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: It’s one of ours. Where did you find this?

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Follow me.
[He takes them to the basement of one of the houses.]

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: My God!  There is enough firepower here for a small army.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Some of this ordnance was manufactured for the Order. Igraine even found an Arc Gun in here.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: I was unaware that we had lost some of our inventory.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: We haven’t. Here. Give me a hand with this one. See what’s in there.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: What did you find?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Essex M-86. Thermite Rifle.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: They saw their first field action a few weeks ago.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: This one hasn’t been assigned yet. How did the Rebels get their hands on these?

Speaker: Perceval
Text: I’m making it my business to find out.

Speaker: Constable
Text: Begging your pardon, Sir. You’re needed upstairs.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: That’s our cue.
[There’s a shooting going on upstairs.]

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: I believe mademoiselle requires our attention.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Igraine, we’re in position!

Speaker: Igraine
Text: About time!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Move out!

Speaker: Igraine
Text: What took you all so long?!?!

Speaker: Rebel
Text: More Knights, from the shop!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: One of them got a thermite rifle!

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Understood. Rebels on the first floor!

Speaker: Igraine
Text: On the roof!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: I see them.

Speaker: Constable
Text: We need back up! These bloody rebels outnumber us!

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Inspector, stay under cover! Galahad, enemies in the distillery!

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Nom de dicu! There! That door! That’s our way through.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Inspector! NO!

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: We have to help him! Cover me!

Speaker: Igraine
Text: All clear! Bring him inside!

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Quickly!

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Take his arms. Gently, monsieur.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: I have him.

Speaker: Rebel
Text: We have them pinned down!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Ready? Let’s move him.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: They’re bringing reinforcements!

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: We’re sitting ducks out here!

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Here comes another!

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Monsieur, only few more feet to go!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: We’re clear! Move in!
[One of the rebel bullets hits Perceval in the neck.]

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Igraine! Go! Help me with the bookcase!

Speaker: Igraine
Text: That went well.
[Perceval drinks Black Water from a pendant and his wound heals instantly.]

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Galahad, Find us a way out of here.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Working on it. How bad is it?

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: A punctured lung I think. Another bullet through the stomach.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Just rest easy, son. You’re going to be alright.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: The Rebels are regrouping.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: I think I’ve found our way out.
[He removes the thermite clip of the rifle and hangs it on a fallen tank.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Everyone. Stand back. Igniting!
[The clip burns the tank like paper.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Can we move him?

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: It no longer matters, monsieur.
[He cross himself.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Save your prayers, Lafayette. There is no god to help him. Come on… Let’s go!

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: There! The hospital.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: We’re only a few hundred yards away.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: And these rebel gobshites will be waiting for us.

Speaker: Rebel
Text: Don’t let them get any further!

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Let’s get on with it. We’re losing precious time.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Holy shit!  Who built this fucking town? Dead ends everywhere!

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Quite the shortcut. Brilliant. What now?

Speaker: Rebel
Text: Lafayette! Monocular! They’re hiding behind those columns! We need to press forward. Now!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: There’s a weak spot in the trucks. If I can get up there I should be able to bring the structure down. Igraine, Lafayette, I’ll need you to provide cover. Perceval, with me.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: The thermite fire in pinning us down!

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Galahad we need to take their thermite position out! Give me a hand with this! Ready? Galahad, use the thermite to bring the bridge down. Igraine, Lafayette, stand ready! The path should be cleared shortly!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: The thermite is in place! Watch yourselves below!

Speaker: Igraine
Text: It looks like the rebels are retreating!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Let’s move forward!

Speaker: Perceval
Text: We are advancing toward target. Find a way to join us.
[Galahad descends from the roof of the building and approaches a constable leading the tied rebel.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Hey! Where is your commanding officer?

Speaker: Constable
Text: Over there!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Sergeant!

Speaker: Sergeant
Text: Sir! What are Her Majesty’s Knights doing?

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Why haven’t you secured the perimeter?

Speaker: Sergeant
Text: We… heard things up there. Safer to stay back.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Bugger safety!

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Do you hear that?

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Where are the rest of the Rebels?

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Exactly. It’s dead silent. Something’s not right.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Galahad! Did you -

Speaker: Galahad
Text: I saw it. Half-Breeds.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: They’re converging on the hospital.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: We need to disperse them. Quickly.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Call it in.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Sentinel 5, this is Galahad. Do you copy?

Speaker: Radio
Text: Sir Galahad, this is Sentinel 5. On standby.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Sentinel 5. Requesting an immediate sonar payload drop.

Speaker: Radio
Text: Confirming Galton payload deployment. Requesting visual beacon for target location.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Dammit! Who has a transmitter?

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Here, monsieur. Use my communicator.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Well, the lad’s useful after all.

Speaker: Radio
Text: Locking on beacon. Releasing anchor. Galton deployment in five… four… three… two… one…

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Incoming! All devices off!
[A sonic bomb is detonating.]

Speaker: Perceval
Text: That’s our window. Go! Find out where these bloody things are coming from! I’ll cover the rear.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Monsieur. You will need this.  You will need this. Be careful, my friends.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Always, Marquis.
[They go inside the building.]
[Galahad is trying to turn on the flashlight.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Let’s hope these work.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: What does your fabled instinct tell you now?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: I’d say we should be prepared for anything?

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Nothing special in that. Admit it, you’re getting rusty.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: God’s blood.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: What could have happened here?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Our bedlamites again, I’d say. No telling how many they might have killed in their escape.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Look there. Such indiscriminate slaughter… I’ve never seen its like before. The Lycans are escalating their rampages.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: The exit is on the other side. Let’s find another way through.
[Soon they stumble upon the rebels.]

Speaker: Igraine
Text: The gate is opened, we have a way through. Stay alert.

Speaker: Rebel
Text: Fuck! We’ve got trouble coming! Shoot them! Kill ’em both!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Be on the lookout! There might be more.

Speaker: Rebel
Text: Knights inbound!

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Up there, on the generator! We’re almost there… Let’s hope there are no more distractions along the way. The hospital is this way.
[They’re coming up to the surface.]

Speaker: Igraine
Text: What is it? Who’s Perceval talking to?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: No one. Just some poor sod off the street.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Let’s move. It’s only a matter of time until the Lycans regroup and return.
[The hospital is in the neighborhood. They enter the building. There, like everywhere else, filth and destruction is where greatness and wealth used to be.]

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Well, so much for the London Hospital. To think this was once the flagship of our medical expertise.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: These patients have been mauled. The Lycans weren’t the only ones to run rampant here. Time has taken its own toll on this place.

Speaker: Voice
Text: Hey mate, did you hear something?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Isi, we have company.

Speaker: Voice
Text: I could have sworn someone was talking.

Speaker: Rebel
Text: Oh shit! Bloody Knights! What in the world were they doing here?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: There may be more to this hospital than we suspected… we should keep moving.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Gray, one of us should search the basement.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Agreed. I’ll head downstairs.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Alright, I’ll go this way. Get on the comm if you find anything.
[Few minutes later.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Igraine. Come in. The power is out in the basement.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: It’s the same here…

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Proceed with caution.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: …Galahad… I believe I found something…

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Repeat, Isi. I can barely make you out.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: You’ll want to take a look at this…

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Isi?

[We’re losing contact. Galahad continues to examine the dark corridors of the asylum, looking into the wards and examining documents. In the murky darkness, pierced only by the light of a lantern, he sees the patient hunched down and sitting on the floor. His face is covered in blood. He starts slowly turning into a Lycan. Galahad retreats and shoots back, but the Lycan manages to grab him.]

Speaker: Lycan
Text: You swine! I can smell you, human.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Fuck… Isi! We have a problem!  Dammit!
[Galahad takes the elevator to get higher, fighting the Lykan. Soon it retreats.]

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Gray, is that you?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Yes, it’s me, Isi.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: I lost you on the comm; where are you?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Triage room. I found a mark. An Elder.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: An Elder? Here? This doesn’t make sense.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Let’s hurry. The Half-Breed is hurt and out for blood. Can you open the gate?

Speaker: Igraine
Text: I’m trying.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Try to find something to pry it open. I’ll clear the debris on this side.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Alright. Gray!
[The Lycan is jumping from somewhere on top. It knocks the gun out of Galahad’s hands, so he has to defend himself with a knife.]

Speaker: Lykan
Text: Be still…
[Igraine beats him from behind with a sharp stick, causing a serious wound on his back. The Lycan doesn’t like it very much.]

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Gray! Get up!
[She fights long and unsuccessfully while Galahad regains consciousness. He takes an axe and slaughters the monster with a few powerful blows.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Isi! Isi… stay with me. Come on, Isi…
[He gives some Black Water.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Come on… drink.
[She sucks the air with her mouth hard. Galahad takes her in his arms.]

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Grey… It hurts…

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Isi, you’ll be fine.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: I can’t do this much longer… Not this life…

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Save your strength.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: We deserve better… You and I… together… we deserve better.
[Someone’s running past, but it’s impossible to see anything because of the damn darkness.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Hey, you! That woman again…

Speaker: Igraine
Text: No, Gray. The ward… To the left. There’s… there’s something you need to see.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: What is it?
[She loses consciousness. Galahad goes into a large room, which turns out to be the base of the rebels.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: What are these rebels up to? Rest easy, love.
[He puts Igraine on the table and starts to explore the room. ]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: What could the rebels be planning here…? A photograph of Lord Hastings. They’re getting organized. Here, the Agamemnon shipment. Destined for the eastern coast of the Americas. The Agamemnon shipping manifest. All the cargo is destined for the Americas. London high society… This poor sod was burned beyond recognition. He was surely tortured first. United India uniforms… No ranks or assignments on the sleeves. That must be it!
[He pry open a wooden box and finds an audio note.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Come, Isi. I’ll help you up.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: How long was I out?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Long enough to have me worried.

Speaker: Radio
Text: Galahad, where in the world have you been?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Perceval, we may have a situation on our hands.

Speaker: Radio
Text: What is it?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: First, call in Nikola. We’ll need armament. The Rebels turned the psychiatric ward into hideout and what looks like a staging area. There are clues that indicate a potential threat to the United India Company, and Lord Hastings.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: I’m telling you. I am fine now.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: You still need some time to recuperate.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: I assure you, Gray, I’m perfectly well.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Will there ever be a time when you will heed my advice, Isi?

Speaker: Igraine
Text: You know the answer to that question, but you would have to obtain father’s blessing first.
[They’re leaving the asylum. There’s Lafayette waiting for them outside.]

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: My friend Galahad!

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Well, Marquis. Where have your concerns for my well-being gone?

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Oh, mademoiselle! I never doubted for a moment that you would prevail over these miscreants. However, the same cannot be said of your gallant knight…

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Not a word of this to anyone, Nikola, understand?

Speaker: Tesla
Text: As you wish. You’re taking a big risk.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: What did I tell you, monsieur?

Speaker: Perceval
Text: We’d almost given you up for lost.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: I - we were… unavoidably detained.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Come. We don’t have much time.

Speaker: Tesla
Text: Sir. This is for you as well. It should all be in working order.
[He gives him the electrical overload device he showed earlier.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Thank you, Nikola. And the other weapon?
[Tesla pulls out a revolver.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: You never fail to deliver. Perceval, for you. Might come in handy.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: The Agamemnon. What’s its status?

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: It has already departed on its way to Portsmouth for its last port of call before it leaves for the Americas.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: And the security detail on board, have they been made aware of the rebel threat?

Speaker: Perceval
Text: For all we know, the guard detail could have been infiltrated by the conspirators. We need to unravel this without arousing suspicion.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: The Council should at least be apprised of the situation.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: We don’t have the luxury of seeking the council’s permission.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: And how would you suggest we do that, mon General? It is already airborne.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: That should be easy.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: You read my mind.
[They’re watching a blimp fly by.]

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Sentinel 5, we are on board!

Speaker: Radio
Text: Acknowledge, Sir Perceval! Sentinel 5 is casing back and will remain available for support.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Confirmed. Thanks for the drop off Captain.

Speaker: Radio
Text: Good luck Sir! Sentinel 5 out.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Is this your idea of easy, Monsieur?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: We are all secure, Perceval! We move on your mark.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Igraine! Lafayette!

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: This is most precarious my friends!

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Giving up so soon Marquis?

Speaker: Perceval
Text: In position! I’ll shadow you.
[Galahad, Lafayette and Igraine repels down the blimp. Perceval follows them.]

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Quickly, let’s get inside.
[They get inside the blimp.]

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Stow your gear. Lafayette and Galahad, you need to gain control of the cockpit, Quietly.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Understood.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Isabeau and I will do reconnaissance. We need eyes on the ground, amongst the guests.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: And imagine me with nothing to wear. I suppose I’ll have to go dress shopping.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Rules of engagement, Monsieur?

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Do what you must. We don’t have time to distinguish between rebel conspirators and the company guards.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: We’ve worked without a safety net before.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: That is true. But then again, we are commandeering the flagship of the United India Company’s feet.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Questions? Then let’s move out.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Sebastien, I must ask you. Who was the old man you were talking to in Mayfair and Whitechapel?

Speaker: Perceval
Text: The old man… It’s a long story. One that I will share with you when the time is right. There is still much that I have to find out for myself.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: I hope you know what you are doing. It seems that the council grows weary of your defiance.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: The Order is not what it once was, Grayson.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Yes. You’ve said that much before.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Patience, old friend. All in due time. Remember. Stealth mode.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Marquis?

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Mademoiselle has my absolute assurances. I shall be us silent as the grave. The path looks clear of guards. We should hurry!

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Wait for my go-ahead. On me… go. Secure the cockpit and await further orders.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: This way, monsieur!

Speaker: Guard 1
Text: If you ask me, men were not meant to fly in machines.

Speaker: Guard 2
Text: Well, no one is asking you.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Redcoats!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Good. Our entrance was not noticed by the guards.

Speaker: Guard 2
Text: Late for me shit, I better get to my post.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: The lock appears to be magnetic.

Speaker: Guard 1
Text: Progress they call it. Looks like a death trap to me.
[Galahad powers down the castle with Tesla’s invention. The guard’s light bulb goes out too.]

Speaker: Guard 1
Text: Huh? What the…? Job for a mechanic, not a guard. I don’t know why I even bother. Best built ship, my eye.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: There.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Galahad, Lafayette. We just encountered resistance from company guards: they are using deadly force. Reciprocate if necessary.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Understood.

Speaker: Guard 1
Text: The hell is wrong with this thing? Maybe a loose wire…?
[Galahad quietly sneaks up and kills the guard by stabbing him in the throat.]

Speaker: Loudspeaker
Text: Ladies and Gentleman, on behalf of the United India Company and its leadership, I would like to welcome you onboard the Agamemnon. As we depart London, our next port of call will be Portsmouth. We will then continue our journey across the Atlantic Ocean where will make a brief landfall, to our final destination of Lakehurst, New Jersey.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: I don’t see any guards. It’s empty.

Speaker: Loudspeaker
Text: Our expected travel time will be approximately three days and six hours.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Belles instrumentations! Truly marvellous…

Speaker: Loudspeaker
Text: On behalf of the crew, I would like to wish our Security Operations, come in. Be sure to have someone verify that the cargo is secured.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: I am right behind you monsieur. I can see three in the cockpit. The guard may present a challenge.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: We’ll just have to improvise.

Speaker: Pilot
Text: Settle in, boys. Next mooring is at Portsmouth, and then it’s an uneventful few days to the Americas. Can’t even tell we’re airborne when I’m back in the hold.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Smoke grenade. On your mark.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Three… two… one.
[They break out into the cockpit and defeat everyone in hand-to-hand combat.]

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: We seize this ship in the name of liberty.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Perceval, the cockpit is secured. Lafayette will remain at the helm. What is your status?

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Lord Hastings is in the vicinity of the ballroom, ant of your location. We will try to get eyes on him. Get here fast.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Acknowledged. I shall apprise you once I have made reconnaissance.  Remember. A steady hand on the tiller at all times.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Leave it to me, monsieur.
[Galahad heads to the ballroom and trying to be undetected.]

Speaker: Worker
Text: Dammit, Bailey! Always forgets to keep the comm centre door locked!

Speaker: Guard 1
Text: Did you hear? The company posted sharpshooters down at Blackwall…

Speaker: Guard 2
Text: Just a rumour. But best keep clear of the docks, just the same. And if there is any truth to it, you’re better off not talking about it.

Speaker: Guard 1
Text: Aye, good point. Wouldn’t want any trouble.

Speaker: Guard 3
Text: Are the others in position?

Speaker: Guard 4
Text: Aye, our Lord Hastings should be none the wiser.
[Galahad reaches the ballroom. HE hides behind a column.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Perceval, we have a complication. Lucan is on board.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: My brother? What is the Knight commander doing here?

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Everything seems to be running smoothly.

Speaker: Lord Hastings
Text: Yes, Sir Lucan. Quite smoothly. We shall be in Portsmouth in a few hours.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Indeed. Then off to the Americas.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Dammit. He was to escort the lords until the ship reached our borders.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Should he be informed of the situation?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: And risk alerting the rebel agent?

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Galahad is right.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Alastair will not appreciate being kept out of this.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Worry about that later. He might yet be welcome support if the situation requires it. We proceed as planned.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Understood. I’ll let you know when I have a better vantage point.
[He assembles Tesla’s sniper rifle.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: In position.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: You are to hold fire until we have a confirmed target.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Weapons hold confirmed.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: The rebels are using stolen company uniforms; they’ll be dressed as guards.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Guards without proper insignias: the uniforms in Whitechapel didn’t have shoulder patches.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Indeed. Keep me informed.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: No patch… Perceval, we have a rebel on the ground floor.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Understood. Keep searching.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Hmm, can’t see the correct shoulder… A patch. Perceval, the guard atop the stairs is bona fide.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Good. Keep looking.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Turn so I can see… Damn, no patch. There is a rebel on the opposing balcony.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Acknowledge. Make sure you check them all.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Patch confirmed. The guard nearest Hastings checks out.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Excellent. Check the remaining guards.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: That was the last one.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Good. Eliminate any threats.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Acknowledge. Weapon loaded.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Good hunting.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: One down. One remaining.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Galahad, have you cleared the rebels?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Soon…
[He kills them all and screams.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Lucan! Rebels! Get Hastings out now!

Speaker: Rebel
Text: Hastings got away! I need backup! Everyone, move to plan B.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Perceval, the mark is down! Rebels incoming! I need support now!

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Understood. We’ll converge on you.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: I can see where they’re coming from.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Contain their point of ingress at all costs!

Speaker: Rebel
Text: On the upper floor! Sniper! Stay in cover! Force him to come to us!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Lunatics! Incendiary weapons aboard an airship!?

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Galahad! We’re facing heavy resistance from the rebels.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: How many of them are on this bloody ship!?

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: My friends! The company guard have just been put on high alert! I fear those amateurs may shoot anyone on sight!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: What the bloody hell was that?

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: A bomb just detonated on the front engine.

Speaker: Indian Woman
Text: Everyone, fall back!

Speaker: Rebel
Text: Aye, ma’am!

Speaker: Indian Woman
Text: You! With me! We proceed as planned!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Everyone! There is a rebel commander on board! It’s the woman from Whitechapel: I’m in pursuit!

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Do NOT let her get away!

Speaker: Loudspeaker
Text: This is an emergency. Repeat. This is an emergency. All passengers follow evacuation signs to the lifeboat bays.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Perceval. I’ve managed to capture one of the rebels.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Good. Keep him restrained; I’ll be there shortly.

Speaker: Loudspeaker
Text: Severe damage to the starboard side. Emergency response teams to B12 and B13! All lifeboats forward of the ballroom have been launched. Staff, reroute passengers aft!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Perceval, I’ve lost the mark. I’m maintaining pursuit.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Negative. Regroup at the lifeboats: we have a bigger problem. The rebels have a second device or board.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Bloody - alright, I’m on my way back.
[Starboard Emergency Deck.]

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Is this what you call reasonable?

Speaker: Perceval
Text: We could not have foreseen these circumstances, Alastair.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Your mission to Whitechapel was to remain covert! I have received word of numerous casualties and reports of destruction to the London Hospital. And now THIS?!

Speaker: Perceval
Text: I alone will assume responsibility for all the consequences that may befall us.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Sebastien, you do understand there is little I can do to protect you from the wrath of the Lord Chancellor. Or of the Order.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Your father will see reason. Right now, our concern should be finding the other device before it detonates.

Speaker: Lord Hastings
Text: Ehhh… Good Knights, your assistance. We must all hurry off the ship before things get worse.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Sir Lucan will escort you and see to the evacuation. We must resume our pursuit.

Speaker: Sir Hastings
Text: Surely this is a situation for all hands. You do not intend to stay aboard.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: We will join you soon as we can.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Isi, see to these people then head to the cockpit.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: No. I’m coming with you.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Isi! You need to find Lafayette and get off this ship. Your brother charged me to bring you back safely. Do this. For me.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: We need weapons. There is a guard station nearby. We can avail ourselves of the company’s arms.
[They’re going to get guns.]

Speaker: Perceval
Text: The rebels will be sending someone to detonate the second explosive

Speaker: Galahad
Text: The rebel leader, she and an accomplice escaped to enact a contingency plan. That must be it.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Agreed. Let’s get back to it. I’ll stay here. See if you can get to the weapons hold.

Speaker: Loudspeaker
Text: All gentry are away. Repeat. All gentry are away. Company personnel can report to the remaining lifeboats. Kitchen and support staff stay well clear.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Company cats seeing their sinking ship… cowards. Get what you need, then we should move on.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: The quartermaster has stocked this ship well enough to support a small army.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: The Company’s guard are not known for their subtlety…

Speaker: Galahad
Text: I fail to see the benefit in allowing the company to run its own army.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: There may be rebels ahead. Be ready.

Speaker: Loudspeaker
Text: To all souls left on board, do not panic! We are following standard procedure and will be returning to the main hangar. Should the situation deteriorate, the remaining passengers will be offloaded at the nearest mooring tower.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Get the door; I’ll cover you. All this to kill one man.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: The rebels are resorting to bolder methods.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: That they are. But something’s amiss. This is too bold even for them.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: You may be right. But we still must stop them from making things worse.

Speaker: Loudspeaker
Text: Everyone, please stay calm! There is no reason to panic. We are still maintaining buoyancy. The ship’s airworthiness remains intact.

Speaker: Rebel
Text: Knights came out of nowhere and botched the assassination.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Perceval, rebels.

Speaker: Rebel
Text: I’m moving to the second device!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: On my mark.
[He breaks the door with his shoulder.]

Speaker: Rebel
Text: Damn it! Get to the others! We can’t let the Knights reach the second device!

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Coach-gun! At the far end! Keep moving! We have to find that second device!

Speaker: Rebel
Text: We’ve got to hold ’em long enough to get the device armed! One of them has moved up through the hall!

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Room clear! We need to keep after the mark! He must have gone through there.
[They’re bumping into a heap. Perceval picks up the fallen closet.]

Speaker: Perceval
Text: I got it! Here, Grayson, can you get through?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: I think so!

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Look out! That was a close one, old friend.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Too close for comfort.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Leave it be!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: There must be another way.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: There’s no time. Go on without me. I’ll find another way through. And don’t lose the mark!

Speaker: Rebel
Text: Oh shit! Knight!

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Lalayette what’s going on?

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: The damage from the explosion is getting worse.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: How long can you stabilize the ship?

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Not long, monsieur.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Do what you can, Marquis. Just give us a few more minutes.

Speaker: Loudspeaker
Text: Fire crews, focus on keeping the flames away from the gasoline feeds at D-23 und 11.4.M2

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Perceval, there were rebels in the cabins; I’ve cleared them out and am continuing my pursuit.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Understood. I’m heading to the stern of the ship and will sweep back towards you.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Lafayette?!?

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: We lost multiple gas cells! The ship is uncontrollable.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Yet he won’t leave! He’s almost as stubborn as you are.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Marquis, abandon ship. Igraine, if you have to knock him unconscious and drag him to a lifeboat.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: My pleasure.
[Galahad and Perceval manage to catch up with the runaway.]

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Galahad! Hold your fire!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: There is no time Perceval! We have to stop him!

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Trust me, Grayson! Listen to me lad. Stand down!

Speaker: Runaway
Text: You have no idea who you’re dealing with! We are not the enemy!

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Then prove it! Stop this madness.

Speaker: Runaway
Text: No! Not as long as the company is allowed to carry on unobstructed.

Speaker: Perceval
Text: They won’t. We’ll see to it.

Speaker: Runaway
Text: It’s too late.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Sebastien!

Speaker: Perceval
Text: Friend! You don’t have to do this…
[But he still detonates the bomb. Perceval and Galahaf are thrown away.]

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Igraine calling Perceval. Come in, Perceval. Galahad, acknowledge. Gray, Sebastien… come in!
[The blimp is crashing down. Galahad gets up hard and drinks Black Water. He starts hobbling through the burning ruins of a blimp. The screams of the wounded and dying can be heard all around.]

Speaker: Voice
Text: -this way! Found someone over here! Here! I need help with this one!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Damn it!  Isi… I’m here. Isi, can you hear me? For God’s sake, respond. Shit…
[He sees a body lying on the ground.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Sebastien…

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Lucan, Sagramor, Elyan, we’ve lost contact with Perceval and Galahad. I need any able-bodied Knight in the vicinity of the Crystal Palace to respond

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Isi…

Speaker: Constable
Text: M’Lady, no one is believed to have survived the crash…

Speaker: Galahad
Text: It’s me…

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Gray?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: No…

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Gray! Respond! Where the hell are you? Everyone! Sir Galahad is alive! Find him!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Aaaaaah…
[Galahad finds the body of Sir Perceval. He falls to his knees and roars in pain and despair.]
[Next scene. Galahad, Lafayette and Igraine go down in the elevator. Galahad is immersed in dark thoughts. Lafayette and Igraine look without knowing what to say.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: I’ll do this alone. You two head up to the Council.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Gray…

Speaker: Galahad
Text: It’s alright, Isi. I’ll join you in time for the Succession.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: My thoughts are with you, Sir.
[They’re going back upstairs. The Galahad approaches Tesla. He, too, appears to have been touched by Percival’s death.]

Speaker: Tesla
Text: My condolences. Sir Perceval was a great man. The best of us. I took the liberty of… keeping this aside. I know it is not standard protocol.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Grayson, do not blame yourself for what happened. Let this cloud pass.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: How can I? He was my mentor… my brother.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: So he was. But concern yourself with the upcoming solemnities. The rest can wait.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Too many questions remain Alastair. I intend to find answers. Malory’s death will be avenged.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Do not fall prey to dark thoughts of retribution. That way madness lies. Come. The Council awaits our presence. Lord Hastings is on his way from the United India House. He wishes to thank you in person for saving his life and the lives of all the other people on the ship. The United India Company owes you a debt of gratitude.

Speaker: Lord Chancellor
Text: For over six centuries, the knight called Sir Perceval sat with us in brotherhood. He saw entire kingdoms perish, and others, equally transitory, take their place. He saw the rise of the Hall Breeds, and was relentless in their pursuit. To all these things he bore witness because he was blessed by this. The Grail. The Blackwater that courses through our veins. The bond that unites this Order. The elixir which heals all wounds and extends the life of natural men. Yet it cannot ensure immortality. Now… Sebastian Malory, once Sir Perceval, is dead. There is a tradition of bestowing a knighthood, in our order, only on the occasion of the death of him who bears that honour and burden. Generation after generation, new knights have taken the names of their hallowed predecessors. We are assembled here today on just such a solemn occasion. From blood of old… the Grail will give new life. Do you, Marie Joseph Paul Yves Roch Gilbert du Motier, Marquis de Lafayette, swear to uphold the most noble precepts of our order; do you pledge to give your life in service to our righteous cause?

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: With all my heart and soul.

Speaker: Lord Chancellor
Text: Drink. May the Grail give you life beyond life.
[Lafayette drinks Black Water - apparently for the first time in his life - and becomes a Knight of the Order.]

Speaker: Lord Chancellor
Text: By this communion, you are bound to our sacred Order. Henceforth, only your blood shall replenish this vial. May the Blackwater… Always use it wisely. I dub thee, Sir Perceval… servant of our Great King and Knight of the Round Table. Rise, Sir Perceval and assume your rightful place at our table. Guards! Remove Sebastien Malary’s body from the Council Chamber and take him to the crypt. This council is now called to order. Let the terrible tragedy which has befallen us serve as a warning to those who would defy the mandates of this office. The late Sebastien Malory did not perish in the fight against the Half-Breeds. He died a victim of his own heedless enterprise and the negligence of those sworn to uphold the highest standards of duty and sacrifice. And to what purpose?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Lord Chancellor, I must obj-

Speaker: Lord Chancellor
Text: Public buildings destroyed, innocent citizens placed at risk, incalculable damage done to United India Company properly. It is only by the mercy of Providence that an even greater disaster was avoided. All this while not a single rebel was taken into custody. On the contrary, by their rogue actions, the knights in question may have done the enemy a great service.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: The Lord Chancellor perhaps speaks too harshly. He would do well to remember that Sir Perceval’s force did uncover evidence of a rebel effort against the…

Speaker: Lord Chancellor
