Text: Circumstantial evidence. Mere supposition, all of which resulted in a… deplorable calamity. I will hear no more on the matter.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: With respect, Lord Chancellor-

Speaker: Lord Chancellor
Text: Sit down, Sir Galahad!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: With respect, I, too, have lost a friend. More than a friend. A brother. You do great wrong to sully his name in such a manner.

Speaker: Lord Chancellor
Text: You dance on the very edge of insubordination, Sir Knight.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: I am apprehensive of my responsibility in this affair. Yet if the same circumstances should present themselves - I would do exactly as I have done. As Malory wished.
[The building’s a shake a little. There’s a guard running into the room.]

Speaker: Guard
Text: My Lord! Sir? The rebels have ambushed Lord Hastings’ carriage. He and his escort are trapped on the Westminster Bridge!

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: All knights, to arms! Protect Lord Hastings. Let’s eliminate these godless rebels once and for all!

Speaker: Lord Chancellor
Text: Sir Galahad! This matter is not yet over! Someone will yet answer for Sebastien Malory’s death.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Of that you can be sure…

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Arm yourselves and take defensive positions on the bridge. Galahad, your command.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Let’s go.

Speaker: Soldier
Text: Sir Galahad! The carriage carrying Lord Hastings was hit in the middle of the bridge. We are not sure if anyone’s alive.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Lucan, Igraine, Perceval. With me!

Speaker: Rebel
Text: We’ve got Knights on the west end of the bridge!

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Hastings may still be alive! We must reach him!

Speaker: Rebel
Text: Fuck! One of them has an arc gun! Fend off the Knights until we can finish Hastings!

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Shotgunner spotted!

Speaker: Rebel
Text: Up there, on the trolley!

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Hurry! We Need to get to Hastings!

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Clear! We’ve retaken this portion of the bridge!

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Quickly, we must recover Lord Hastings!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: We need to get Hastings out!

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: I’ll cover you.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Lucan, Igraine. On my mark. Pull him out when I lift the carriage.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Understood.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Ready? Now!

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: We have him! Everyone fall back to the palace.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Gray, where are you going?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: To finish what we started!

Speaker: Igraine
Text: This is no time for vengeance. Come to your senses! Gray, stop!
[Galahad continues to kill the rebels.]

Speaker: Rebel
Text: Damn! That one’s made it through! Stop ’im! Defend the gunner! Don’t let him get through!

Speaker: Rebel 2
Text: Oi! You two! I need one over here, the other on the right. Come on! Hurry!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Sentinel 3, I need air support.

Speaker: Radio
Text: We are approaching your position Sir Galahad.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Acknowledge. Let them come.

Speaker: Rebel
Text: Knight up ahead! Take ’im out!

Speaker: Radio
Text: Sir Galahad, the rebels are in retreat; the Royal Army is en route, they will contain the threat from here.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Fuck the army. This is my fight.

Speaker: Rebel
Text: Shit! He’s got out cannon!

Speaker: Radio
Text: Sir Galahad. The Knight Commander has requested that you abandon pursuit. To all personnel, please remain clear of the East end of Westminster Bridge. We are witnessing heavy artillery fire at the moment.
[After destroying a small rebel army, Galahad goes to kill Rebel 2.]

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Galahad. This is a direct command. Stand down.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Galahad, what are you doing? Come to your senses and return to the Palace.
[Galahad punches the rebel in the face.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Where’s the Indian woman? Where is she?  Where is she? Where? Tell me! Tell ME!

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Sentinel 3, where is Sir Galahad?

Speaker: Radio
Text: Lady Igraine, Sir Galahad is near the east end of the bridge.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Stay on him until we can get to his position!
[Next scene. Galahad walks into the already familiar Aux Belles Muses brothel and kicks the bouncer in the face.]

Speaker: Bouncer
Text: Whoa Whoa, Whoa. Wait.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Landlord! A drink! A drink, goddamn you! Absinthe.
[He puts a gun on the table. When the bartender comes up with the bottle, he takes it away.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: To forget.
[The bartender leaves the counter quietly.]

Speaker: Indian Woman
Text: Are you drowning your sorrows or your ignorance, knight?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Niether. I was waiting for you to show up.

Speaker: Indian Woman
Text: And?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: I need some answers.

Speaker: Indian Woman
Text: Answers? Is that why you killed all my men? Death always follows in your path.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: And yours will be next if you don’t give me what I need.

Speaker: Indian Woman
Text: You’ll have to excuse me if your offer doesn’t entice me. I don’t respond well to threats.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Then, you are of no use to me.

Speaker: Indian Woman
Text: Do you worst.
[There’s another woman coming down to the top floor.]

Speaker: Woman
Text: So much animosity. You look like you could use some of this, knight.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: The Blackwater. But how did you get-?

Speaker: Woman
Text: Shall we call this a temporary truce?  Lower your weapon. Devi!  If it keeps you at ease, you can keep your gun pointed. But I am the one you seek, not her. We have much to discuss. Let us find a more… private setting.  Leave us. We shall talk alone. Attend to our business at Blackwall.
Action: (to Indian woman in Hindi) (to Galahad) (to Devi in Hindi)

Speaker: Devi
Text: As you wish, my queen.

Speaker: Woman
Text: You seek to avenge your friend Malory.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Do not presume to speak his name.

Speaker: Woman
Text: He was betrayed. You have all been betrayed.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Betrayed. By whom?

Speaker: Woman
Text: The men you call masters.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: The Order of Knights calls no one master. Not even the Queen.

Speaker: Woman
Text: You are an empire of bootlickers, grovelling at the feet of the mighty United India Company.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Guard your tongue, woman-

Speaker: Woman
Text: Your "honourable" corporation spreads the very scourge you have so valiantly sworn to fight.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: The rantings of a fanatic.

Speaker: Woman
Text: You seek the wrong enemy. We both fight the same evil.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Why should I believe the word of Rebel and an assassin?

Speaker: Woman
Text: We are more alike than you think.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: We have nothing in common.

Speaker: Woman
Text: Do not allow your friend to have died in vain.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Enough! Tell me why I should not kill you!

Speaker: Woman
Text: There are things worse than death, knight. Much worse. And if it is mine you seek in your misguided quest, then so be it. My death is a worthy sacrifice.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Do you deny the attempt to kill Lord Hastings?

Speaker: Woman
Text: He deserves to die, along with every one of his collaborators.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: And you expect us to just - step aside while you carry out your campaign of terror?

Speaker: Woman
Text: Things are not as they seem. The company’s secrets are well-kept, even from The Order.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: What secrets? I do not have time for games.

Speaker: Woman
Text: There is little I can say to sway your convictions. But there are things I can show you to give you the explanation you need. Your answers await at the company’s docks in Blackwall Yard. But we must hurry.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: You had better be right, for your own sake.

Speaker: Woman
Text: The underground tunnels would lead us to Blackwall Yards. Be prepared to meet heavy resistance from the United India Guards.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Until I say otherwise, we will not harm innocent men.

Speaker: Woman
Text: None of them are innocent.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: All the same. You will abide by my rules if you expect me to follow you.

Speaker: Woman
Text: Very well.
[Galahad removes the uniform of the Knight of the Order.]

Speaker: Woman
Text: Hanging up your colours so soon?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: The Order cannot be seen as having any part of this.
[Meanwhile, Igraine sees Galahad and the woman.]

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Gray… what games are you playing?
[She enters the bar and finds part of the knight’s outfit under the counter. Galahad left his on the second floor.]

Speaker: Igraine
Text: This can not be…
[Back to Galahad and the woman.]

Speaker: Woman
Text: What do you know of pure bloods?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: The Half-Breeds’ ancestors? An ancient race born into their unnatural state. Not turned like most others. They are all but extinct.

Speaker: Woman
Text: You are wrong to speak of them in the past. They walk among us.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: The support structure has collapsed. Here.

Speaker: Woman
Text: Such a gallant knight.

Speaker: Woman
Text: I fought against their ilk in Jhansi. The United India Company is their agent.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: If you are so adamant, then show me proof.

Speaker: Woman
Text: We should be able to move this together. Ready when you are. There’s the exit. Wait, there’s someone here.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Workers?

Speaker: Woman
Text: Quiet.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Quickly! Take cover.

Speaker: Worker
Text: Who’s there? This is private property!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: I feared as much. I was lost in the tunnels.

Speaker: Worker
Text: Who the devil are you?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Another lost traveller in this infernal city, it appears. If you don’t mind me asking, where am I?

Speaker: Worker
Text: Blackwall Yards, United India Docks.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Oh… definitely not where I thought.

Speaker: Worker
Text: Well, you’ll have to go back the way you came.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Back through the tunnels? A trifle easier to climb up to the streets, wouldn’t you say?

Speaker: Worker
Text: Back you go…
[The woman hist the worker with a stick from behind.]

Speaker: Woman
Text: Don’t worry. He’s only resting. Though his head might pain him for some time after. Look, there’s the street.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: The city’s expanding the embankment. Give me a hand with this.

Speaker: Woman
Text: Ready.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Just a little further… Alright, stop. We should be able to climb up from here.

Speaker: Woman
Text: Good idea, there’s a route across

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Keep up and watch your footing. Give me your hand!

Speaker: Woman
Text: This way. I’ll unlock the gate from inside.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Here, I’ll help you. Hurry. A patrol is bound to pass this way sooner or later.

Speaker: Woman
Text: Just a moment longer…

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Sniper!
[Galahad gets bullet in the shoulder and hides.]

Speaker: Guard
Text: Intruders! Rise the alarm!

Speaker: Woman
Text: What now? Still think we can subdue them without killing anyone?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Stay in cover! I’ll find a way to get to the sniper.

Speaker: Woman
Text: Hurry, I’m pinned down!
[Galahad is starting to kill.]

Speaker: Guard
Text: Up hers, on the roof! Bloke’s gone behind the chimney! Pin him down! Rebel, down the street! Get her! Up on the balcony, there’s another one!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: The street’s clear. Stay put while I handle the sniper,

Speaker: Guard
Text: Look out! Shit! There’s one right here! I need bloody backup! Don’t go dying on me.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: I don’t have time for this!

Speaker: Guard
Text: Go, suppressing fire!

Speaker: Woman
Text: More guards on the street!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Hold on, I’m nearly there.

Speaker: Guard
Text: We’ve almost got the rebel bitch, keep her cornered!
[Galahad sneaks up on a sniper and stabs him.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Move forward! Move up! I’ll provide cover!

Speaker: Woman
Text: More guards are coming!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Then keep your bloody head down!

Speaker: Guard
Text: Get the bloody quim! Hold the line! Keep these blighters out!

Speaker: Woman
Text: I’m clear! I’m moving into that foundry! Behind you!
[Galahad is being attacked by a guard. He shoots at him several times. Then they start fighting and fall to the ground from the balcony.]

Speaker: Woman
Text: Are you alright?
[Galahad drinks Black Water and recovers.]

Speaker: Woman
Text: Keep moving! I’ll cover you!

Speaker: Guard
Text: At the crate! Get the blighter, before we lose him! The git’s wounded! Finish him off!

Speaker: Woman
Text: Grenade!
[Galahad throws a grenade back and runs to some warehouse. The women run after him and close the door.]

Speaker: Woman
Text: So much for keeping this friendly.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Damn it! I’m in no mood to jest. You said you had proof! Where is it?

Speaker: Woman
Text: Patience, knight. We are almost there.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Let’s find our way out of here

Speaker: Woman
Text: Agreed. We can’t stay here for long.

Speaker: Guard
Text: Over here! Damn… they’ve sealed the door. Can we shoot the lock off?

Speaker: Guard 2
Text: That’ll do us no good sir. Steel lock.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: We need to find another way.

Speaker: Woman
Text: Perhaps it can be unlocked from the other side?

Speaker: Guard
Text: You lot! Watch this door, make sure they don’t try to slink off!

Speaker: Guard 2
Text: On it sir!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: This hoist might still work…

Speaker: Woman
Text: It’s getting closer to the platform.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: That should be close enough.

Speaker: Woman
Text: I have this; you go up there.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: I think I can reach the hoist from up here.

Speaker: Woman
Text: I’ll work the chain. Can you reach the other side?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: I can manage.
[Galahad clambs to another part of the warehouse and opens the door.]

Speaker: Woman
Text: Knight, over here. On my count of three. One, two…
[They break the door open and stumble into a guard.]

Speaker: Guard
Text: They’re in here! Hurry!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Look out!

Speaker: Guard
Text: Lock the door! Don’t let them out!

Speaker: Woman
Text: Up by the hoist!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: We’re clear… for now.

Speaker: Woman
Text: Let’s get out of here. Over here, there’s enough space to get through. This way.
[An Indian girl from a bar comes up to them.]

Speaker: Devi
Text: Rani. What is he doing here?

Speaker: Rani
Text: Devi. It’s alright, you can speak freely. Devi! Go on.

Speaker: Devi
Text: It is the same as the airship, Rani. The cargo is bound for the Americas and the West Indies.

Speaker: Rani
Text: How many?

Speaker: Devi
Text: More than twice the last shipment. They are making up for lost time.

Speaker: Rani
Text: This shipment cannot reach the shores of the new continent.

Speaker: Devi
Text: There’s more. Security is on high alert… His name was mentioned. They are arranging a meeting.

Speaker: Rani
Text: We may be in luck yet.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Whose name was mentioned?

Speaker: Rani
Text: One of your esteemed lords. If he is coming here for a meeting, then you shall see for yourself.
[He sees Lord Hastings passing by.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: This proves nothing. Lord Hastings is chamberlain and a peer. He is often in our council.

Speaker: Rani
Text: Yes. Privy to the order’s operations. How convenient for him.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: You imagine conspiracies where none exist.

Speaker: Rani
Text: Look at the cargo, knight, and talk to me of fantasies.

Speaker: Devi
Text: Do you trust him, my queen?

Speaker: Rani
Text: The scientist says he will certainly listen to reason.

Speaker: Devi
Text: What if he doesn’t?

Speaker: Rani
Text: Then he shall be dealt with.

Speaker: Devi
Text: This way, Rani.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: The Rani of Jhansi.

Speaker: Rani
Text: I surprise you again, Knight.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: The famous warrior queen who took up arms against our army in India. Our generals reported you killed in Gwalior.

Speaker: Rani
Text: I have always benefitted from the underestimation of fools. Knight, come take a look at this. There! The shipment is being loaded. This foul cargo must never be allowed to leave here. Hurry! The exit is this way.

Speaker: Devi
Text: Rani, there are too many guards present.

Speaker: Rani
Text: Nothing we haven’t encountered before. It would be safer to call for reinforcements. Not yet. Not until we locate the shipment.

Speaker: Devi
Text: And once we find it, what are your orders?

Speaker: Rani
Text: We will deal with it as necessary. For now we must remain cautious.

Speaker: Devi
Text: Yes, Rani.

Speaker: Rani
Text: Devi, I need you to go and guard the escape routes.

Speaker: Devi
Text: Rani, I should escort you. It is my duty to protect you.

Speaker: Rani
Text: Devi, it’s an order.  Over here, we can cross through the ship to the main warehouse.

Speaker: Devi
Text: What are you waiting for? Follow after her.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: I’ll man the crank; keep an eye out while I raise the platform. That’s as far as it will go.

Speaker: Rani
Text: Help me up. I’ll take a look inside. I see number of guards. We need to move quietly.

Speaker: Guard
Text: Stay sharp you lot: if they spot the rebels, it’s our job to clean them up.

Speaker: Guard 2
Text: Aye sir. Looking forward to it. What in… Intruders! Alert Hastings’ guard detail!

Speaker: Guard
Text: Second section! Get your arses up here!

Speaker: Guard 3
Text: Yeah, we’re coming!

Speaker: Rani
Text: More guards in the left! One of them has a detonator! Sniper! Atop the crane!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: The deck is clear. We should move.

Speaker: Rani
Text: Agreed. I believe we can reach the other side from below. This lift should get us below deck.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Ready? More guards near the warehouse.

Speaker: Rani
Text: Wait, where are they going?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Come on.

Speaker: Guard
Text: Get cross and stop them! They’re boarding the ship!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Get ready, we’ll need to go through them.

Speaker: Guard
Text: Move in! Stop them!

Speaker: Rani
Text: More guards, coming down the ramp!
[They enter a warehouse.]

Speaker: Rani
Text: Quite the array of weapons.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Nothing strange about it. The company exports munitions around the globe.

Speaker: Rani
Text: It doesn’t strike you as odd that the dock guards are armed to the teeth with the latest weaponry?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Enough of your speculations. Let’s find what you brought me here for, shall we? This way. On my mark. Be prepared to cover me. Deserted.

Speaker: Rani
Text: A very ill omen.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: They must have fallen back to regroup. We might only have a small window of opportunity before they return. Now—the proof, woman.

Speaker: Rani
Text: As you wish.
[They enter another warehouse.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: What now?

Speaker: Rani
Text: Inspect the cargo, look for any distinguishing marks on the crates. The crates we are looking for have the company’s insignia on the sides. Look for the insignia; it is a red stamp.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: That’s one… can’t reach it though. Ah… found you. Here. This must be what we’re looking for. Help me get this one down. Crowbar?

Speaker: Rani
Text: Look hard, Knight. See the evil we both fight against.
[There’s a corpse in the box with a bloody mouth.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Vampires… it can’t be - how?

Speaker: Rani
Text: The Half-Breeds are consolidating their power. With the protection of the Lycans in your land, Hastings and his vampire ilk are spreading disease throughout your cir…

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Lord Hastings? He can’t be one of them!

Speaker: Rani
Text: Many have witnessed in Whitechapel your noble lord roaming the streets late at night, preying on downtrodden women.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: The Ripper killings?

Speaker: Rani
Text: That is what you call them. How do you think the murderer still continues to evade commissioner Doyle’s dragnet? Whitechapel has become the Kindred’s feeding ground.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: How many more of these are there?

Speaker: Rani
Text: Enough to infect a city.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: God’s Blood! We have to destroy this cargo.

Speaker: Rani
Text: Over here; I found some fuel.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: I’ll light this one. Prepare another.

Speaker: Rani
Text: This one’s ready.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Done.

Speaker: Rani
Text: Over here. Assist me to get up there.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Here.

Speaker: Rani
Text: Let me look for something to help you up.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Alright.

Speaker: Rani
Text: There’s a ladder here. I found another fuel can. Alright, this one’s ready to be lit.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Let’s move on to the rest.

Speaker: Rani
Text: Very well.

Speaker: Guard
Text: They’re burning down the bloody warehouse!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Go. Take care of the remaining cargo. I’ll deal with this lot.

Speaker: Rani
Text: Alright, this section’s lit! There are more crates below, we need to get down there. Keep them off me while I light the crates!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: We’re running out of time!

Speaker: Rani
Text: I’m going as quickly as I can! This area’s lit, I’m moving to the next one! They’ve brought in a detonator! That’s the last of them.
[She checks the door to the streets.]

Speaker: Rani
Text: It’s locked!
[A giant monster sneaks up on their tiptoes.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Lycan!
[They run away.]

Speaker: Rani
Text: There’s a door over here!

Speaker: Devi
Text: Rani, are you in there?

Speaker: Rani
Text: Devi! Am I glad to hear your voice!

Speaker: Devi
Text: Rani. Are you hurt?

Speaker: Rani
Text: No, not yet. But hurry. Break down the door.

Speaker: Devi
Text: At once, Rani!
[The Lycan attacks again, but Galahad and Rani manage to defeat it.]

Speaker: Rani
Text: I never thought to see you again, daughter. How did you find us?

Speaker: Devi
Text: There is no time. The company’s forces are gathering at the shipyard. We must flee.

Speaker: Rani
Text: Knight. Do not tempt fate. Our work here is done.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: This horror must be made known to the council.

Speaker: Rani
Text: Tread carefully, Knight. The Company could not succeed without powerful friends in the government. You saw on the docks how your own ranks have been infiltrated.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: If it is as you say, then surely I would have suspected -

Speaker: Rani
Text: The war has turned against the Half-Breeds. They’re now using the United India Company to spread terror throughout the world. You must help us.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: I am a knight. Sworn to protect the realm. Not bring it crashing down.

Speaker: Rani
Text: Then you must trust no one. Fare you well, knight. Would only we could have met on different circumstances.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Where shall I find you?

Speaker: Rani
Text: Whisper my name in Whitechapel, and I will be there.
[Galahad in anger and determination walks the corridor of Westminster.]

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Gray. What in the world is going on?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Not now Isi.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Don’t walk away from me! I saw you at Whitechapel.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Wha - you followed me?

Speaker: Igraine
Text: I was worried about you. I was worried about you. You fed like a madman after the battle on the bridge.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: You know nothing. Less than nothing.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Is it some kind of clandestine infiltration? Is that what you’re up to?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: This isn’t the time.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Gray what’s happened to you? Ever since Malory was killed, I look at you and -

Speaker: Galahad
Text: What, what do you see?

Speaker: Igraine
Text: I don’t know… Someone I’m not sure I can trust anymore. Whatever it is - for God’s sake, tell me.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Not this time, Isi. And you’d do well to stay clear of me, for your own good.
[He leaves and closes the door behind him. Igraine goes to the guard.]

Speaker: Igraine
Text: You! Find General Lafayette and summon him to the library!
[Galahad tells Lord Counsellor what he saw and knows.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: The conspiracy runs to the very heart of the council.

Speaker: Lord Chancellor
Text: This allegation is monstrous. I refuse to believe it.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: The Lord Chancellor will permit me I can show -

Speaker: Lord Chancellor
Text: I will not permit. And you will say nothing more of these ridiculous suspicions.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: All the years I have known your father, never have I seen him so obstinate.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Your allegations strike at the very heart of the empire. I fear he cannot sustain another blow as great as the loss of Malory,

Speaker: Galahad
Text: All he need do is journey to Blackwall Yard.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: For what evidence? The destruction was total. A clear case of arson, according to Commissioner Doyle. Apparently a small group of rebels was seen on the docs. It was all rather… what is the word the commissioner is so fond of? Ah, yes - "elementary."

Speaker: Galahad
Text: And what do you think?

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: I have no opinion. Should you wish, I can attempt to persuade the Lord Chancellor to put the matter before he council.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: If it is true that we have a traitor in our midst, word is bound to get back to the conspirators.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: What do you propose?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Breach the walls of the United India House under cover of night. Any information that will shed light on the events of the last few days must surely be found there.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Trespass on the Company’s headquarters? You are cut from the same cloth as Malory.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Drastic circumstances call for drastic measures. I would have your assistance, Alastair.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: I hardly think it proper for the Knight Commander to be seen…

Speaker: Galahad
Text: You know the lay of the land. I will need your guidance to navigate the grounds of the United India House. If a conspiracy is to be revealed, your testimony will carry weight with your father.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Very well. But the two of us alone will not sure to infiltrate the compound. If what you say is true, there are precious few we can trust. My sister, Lafayette?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: I cannot involve them until I have more evidence.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Then who?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: I might know just the person who can help us. I thank you, brother.
[They’re getting in a carriage.]

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: We’re approaching the United India House.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: I assume we are not planning to enter through the front door?

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Not to worry, I’ve made preparations for our incursion. Gaining access to the compound proved to be a little more difficult than planned.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: We’re here.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Back entrance to the compound?

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: You could say that…
[He knocks on the door.]

Speaker: Butler
Text: Evening, sir.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Francis. Is everything in place?

Speaker: Francis
Text: As discussed, ordnance is on the table. Rooftop access is through the bedroom.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: You’ve done well, Francis.

Speaker: Francis
Text: At your service, sir.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Crossbow… Brings back memories, ancient ones at that.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: I thought it best we stay silent on this mission. Let’s get going. Compound is patrolled all through the night. Guardsman all entrances.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: What’s the incursion point?

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: The gardens. Should provide us enough cover to move in unnoticed. Follow me. We should head to the rooftops.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Francis’ intelligence does pan out.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Trustworthy man, it seems.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Not really. He has a debt to repay. Failure to deliver on his word would prove most unpleasant to him. We need to find a safe anchor point in the garden to secure the rope to.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Gazebo seems to fit the parameters.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Good. Let’s deploy the line.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Done. Alastair, I need you to stay here and spot my path. Once I’m clear, I’ll give you the go ahead to enter.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Very well. Do be careful. My sister wouldn’t forgive me if I were to return alone.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: What she doesn’t know cannot hurt her.
[He goes down the rope stairs to the gardens.]

Speaker: Guard
Text: Huh? What’s that. Over here somewhere…

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Grayson, I think it unwise to eliminate company guards until we have proof.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: There is no time Alastair. You have to trust me. This is the only way.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Damn... Just get to the lower garden. The gate will be locked. You will need to find the key.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: No key…

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Keep looking… Have you found the key? There are still more guards to search.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: I found the gate.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Very well. Find the guard who has the key.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Understood. I’ve located the key.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Take it and make your way through to the lower garden.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Lucan. I’m through the gate.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Make sure we are clear to proceed. I’m on my way. Follow me. It’s this way.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: What’s next?

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Clear the west wing, I’ll move through the east.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: It would be wise to stay off the communicator from here on.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Good point. Here. Let’s rendezvous inside.
[Galahad notices Rani killing a guard. There’s another guard coming up to her.]

Speaker: Guard
Text: Hey you! Back away! Back away!
[Galahad shot the guard in the head.]

Speaker: Rani
Text: My gallant knight! It seems I came just in time.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: It seems I came just in time.

Speaker: Rani
Text: I suppose so. Though it would not be in my nature to let a guard get the better of me.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Did you come alone?

Speaker: Rani
Text: Devi and Finley are with me. They’re taking care of the rest of the guards. And you?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: I could not risk involving my squad. But there is one more with me.

Speaker: Rani
Text: And you trust this person?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Yes. With my life.

Speaker: Rani
Text: Very well. What now?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: We will meet him inside and proceed to the archives room.

Speaker: Rani
Text: Let’s go. As you can see… we faced some resistance. They’re over here.

Speaker: Devi
Text: Rani, we found a way in.

Speaker: Finley
Text: Once in place, we can use the stage coach to climb the balcony.

Speaker: Rani
Text: Knight. Help us push this into place. That’s it. Let’s go!

Speaker: Finley
Text: Up here…

Speaker: Rani
Text: Devi. No. I need you to stay.

Speaker: Devi
Text: Rani. I need to be by your side.

Speaker: Rani
Text: You always are child.

Speaker: Devi
Text: What of him and his accomplice?

Speaker: Rani
Text: Heed my advice. Do you not know how dear you are to me?

Speaker: Devi
Text: Then why do you push me away?

Speaker: Rani
Text: Because I need you to continue the cause if something happened to me.

Speaker: Devi
Text: Do not say that!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Devi, though you may not trust me. Know that I will protect your Queen in your stead. I owe her and you that much.

Speaker: Devi
Text: See that you do!

Speaker: Rani
Text: You do not want to get on the bad side of that one.
[She kills a guard, but he manages to call for help.]

Speaker: Rani
Text: Take cover! Guards coming through the front gates! More guards! There they are on the balcony!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Let’s get inside before more guards arrive.

Speaker: Guard
Text: Intruders, coming in through the front windows!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Look out! Shotgun specialists! More are coming in from the back!

Speaker: Rani
Text: From downstairs as well!

Speaker: Guard
Text: They’re upstairs! Go!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Looks like that was the last of ’em. More could be here any minute… let’s keep moving.
[They enter Sir Lucan’s room.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Lucan. Hold your fire! This is Lakshmi Bai, the leader of the Rebellion.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: She is your confederate? Have you taken leave of your senses, man?

Speaker: Rani
Text: I might ask the same question.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: If I didn’t know you any better, I’d think you’d led me into a rebel ambush.

Speaker: Rani
Text: As I might fear an arrest.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: We do not have time for this. We needed help and she is the only one I could turn to.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: This is madness! You are putting the very core of our Order in jeopardy.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Alastair, you have to trust me. You asked that we find proof. She was with me in Blackwall, she witnessed what I found there.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: You mean to tell me that she helped you destroy the United India Company docks! My father was right, that was an act of pure terrorism. She used you.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: She brought this conspiracy to my attention and if we are to see it through, her help is invaluable.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: And what if you’re wrong?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Then she and I will answer for our actions, and suffer the consequences.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: As Malory did?
[Lowers his gun.]

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: I hope you’re right, Gray. I would not want to see you on the wrong side of this mess.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Neither would I, brother.

Speaker: Guard
Text: There they are! Far end of the lobby!

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: More guards, coming in on the far end!

Speaker: Rani
Text: Coach-gun!

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Let move. The archives room is this way. Through here, across the courtyard balcony.

Speaker: Rani
Text: Guards, in the courtyard! Sniper! On the right!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Shit! More of them are coming from the basement!

Speaker: Finley
Text: …and one of them has a thermite rifle!

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: That’s the last of them!

Speaker: Rani
Text: A temporary reprieve, let’s move.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Galahad, give me a hand with these doors.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Ready?

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: The archives room is just ahead.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Search the archives. Look for manifests, bills of lading, requisition orders. Anything that might link the Company to the Half-Breeds shipments.

Speaker: Finley
Text: How are we supposed to look through all this?

Speaker: Rani
Text: Keep it down, Finley. Just stand guard while we search.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: There’s nothing here…

Speaker: Rani
Text: There must be something…

Speaker: Finley
Text: Waste of time if you ask me.

Speaker: Rani
Text: Knight! Over here! You will want to see this. These are shipments that were sent to my homeland. If this log is to be believed, the company now has a foothold in every Indian state.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Here. The Agamemnon shipment. And three more shipments planned along the same route. RMS Oceanic is next. It sets sail in six weeks.

Speaker: Rani
Text: Where’s Finley?

[They hear the distant screams and sounds of struggle. They take out a weapon and go in their direction. In the next room, a Lycan kills Finley, then turns into a human being a minute later and puts on his robe.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Lord Hastings?

Speaker: Rani
Text: Do you believe me now?

Speaker: Galahad
Text: The Whitechapel killings. The Half-Breed scourge. United India. All you.

Speaker: Lord Hastings
Text: Jacob van Neck, or as the Fleet Street pamphleteers have so fondly named me – Jack the Ripper, at your service.
[Sir Lucan enters.]

Speaker: Lord Hastings
Text: I thank you, Sir Lucan. For delivering these meddlers.

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Deal with them and do not fail us.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: You.

Speaker: Lord Hastings
Text: Quite fortuitous. Wouldn’t you say, Sir Galahad. The rebel leader captured. And a traitor revealed. All in one fell swoop. The traitor being you, regrettably.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Alastair, how could you?

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Forgive me, brother. I have to look to my own kind above all.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Your kind?
[Lord Hastings rises from his chair.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: RUN!
[He throws a knife that sticks into Lord Hastings’ shoulder. He’s already starting to transform himself. Galahad is attacking Sir Lucan. During the fight, they go down to the cellar.]

Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: He’s behind me. You know what to do!

Speaker: Guard
Text: The authorities are on their way, let’s make sure the bastard’s dead.

Speaker: Radio
Text: Knights, this is command. We have confirmation of multiple intruders at the United India House. The Metropolitan Police has been ordered to remain on stand-by. The protection and safety of Lord Hastings in our primary concern. Apprehend any suspects with extreme caution.
[After a short fight, Galahad stabs Sir Lucas in the belly.]

Speaker: Galahad
Text: We swore an oath.
[Sir Lucan breaks Galahad’s arm and raises his knife in preparation to kill him.]

Speaker: Costable
Text: In the name of the law, open this door!
[Sir Lucan runs away.]

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Galahad, stay where you are!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Wait, I can explain -

Speaker: Igraine
Text: I said, don’t move!
[Lord Hastings enters the room, panting as if he had just been attacked.]

Speaker: Lord Hastings
Text: You arrive in good time.

Speaker: Constable
Text: We received report of a disturbance.

Speaker: Lord Hastings
Text: Sir Galahad stormed in here with a filthy band of rebels intent on killing me.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: It’s a lie.
[Lord Hastings throws on the floor the knife that Galahad had previously stuck in his shoulder.]

Speaker: Lord Hastings
Text: See the result of their little incursion. Sir Galahad’s accomplice was a woman, the leader of the Rebellion, in fact. She eluded our grasp, not for long.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Your will order the company guards to stand down, Lord Hastings. We knights will see to the capture of the rebel leader.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Isi, listen to me. You’re making a grave mistake.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Sir Perceval, take this intruder into custody.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: I am truly sorry this office must fall on upon you, Marquis.

Speaker: Lafayette
Text: No more than I am, monsieur.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: Get him out of my sight.

Speaker: Lord Hastings
Text: I thank you Lady Igraine. Your intervention was truly fortuitous.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: We are only carrying out our sworn duty, Lord Hastings.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: All the same, my lady, you would do well to keep a close eye on that traitor.

Speaker: Igraine
Text: You may expect to be summoned before the courts. Your testimony will be required.

Speaker: Lord Hastings
Text: I am always at the service of Her Majesty Knights. (bows]

Chapter: Chapter XII A TRAITOR AMONGST US
Speaker: Lord Chancellor
Text: The prisoner stand accused of the most heinous crimes. Sir Galahad has betrayed our ancient trust. More than this… he has conspired with godless rebels. Adding to his litany of evil, he has presumed to take the life of our esteemed chamberlain, Lord Hastings. Sir Galahad is a base traitor, a man without honour or scruple. I ask the council to impose the supreme penalty.

Chapter: Chapter XII A TRAITOR AMONGST US
Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: I beg the Council’s indulgence. Let us not forget Sir Galahad’s service to this Order over the centuries. Perhaps our brother knight can be saved and once more put on to the righteous path.

Chapter: Chapter XII A TRAITOR AMONGST US
Speaker: Lord Chancellor
Text: The Knight Commander shows too much leniency. The proof against the traitor is… irrefutable.

Chapter: Chapter XII A TRAITOR AMONGST US
Speaker: Igraine
Text: I saw Sir Galahad… in the company of the rebel leader. I was too far away to hear them clearly. But they seemed on… familiar terms. They were leaving an establishment known to harbour rebels,

Chapter: Chapter XII A TRAITOR AMONGST US
Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Sir Galahad sought an audience with the Lord Chancellor and me. He hurled a number of senseless accusations at the United India Company and seemed intent on finding Lord Hastings.

Chapter: Chapter XII A TRAITOR AMONGST US
Speaker: Lord Chancellor
Text: Bring in Lord Hastings. Lord Hastings… you have identified the prisoners your assailant?

Chapter: Chapter XII A TRAITOR AMONGST US
Speaker: Lord Hastings
Text: Sir Galahad infiltrated our headquarters late night accompanied by the rebel leader… and her followers.

Chapter: Chapter XII A TRAITOR AMONGST US
Speaker: Igraine
Text: I could not be sure that the man I was following was Sir Galahad until… I found his coat, discarded near the rebel hideout.

Chapter: Chapter XII A TRAITOR AMONGST US
Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: As his commander, I tried to dissuade him from pursuing his allegations. It is now clear he did not heed my advice.

Chapter: Chapter XII A TRAITOR AMONGST US
Speaker: Lord Hastings
Text: They incapacitated several of my guards, and entered my chambers… intent on killing me.

Chapter: Chapter XII A TRAITOR AMONGST US
Speaker: Igraine
Text: We found Lord Hastings wounded by the prisoner’s hand.

Chapter: Chapter XII A TRAITOR AMONGST US
Speaker: Lord Hastings
Text: He must stand condemned by his own actions.

Chapter: Chapter XII A TRAITOR AMONGST US
Speaker: Lord Chancellor
Text: Honoured knights, how do you find for the prisoner?

Chapter: Chapter XII A TRAITOR AMONGST US
Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Guilty.

Chapter: Chapter XII A TRAITOR AMONGST US
Text: [The other knights also found the Galahad guilty. Their faces do not show us.]

Chapter: Chapter XII A TRAITOR AMONGST US
Speaker: Igraine
Text: Guilty.

Chapter: Chapter XII A TRAITOR AMONGST US
Speaker: Lafayette
Text: Guilty.

Chapter: Chapter XII A TRAITOR AMONGST US
Text: [Lord Chancellor takes the bottle of Black Water off Galahad’s neck.]

Chapter: Chapter XII A TRAITOR AMONGST US
Speaker: Lord Chancellor
Text: The sentence is death.

Chapter: Chapter XII A TRAITOR AMONGST US
Text: [We’re going back to the beginning scenes of the game. Judging by the dates, Galahad spent 31 days in the stone bag. ]

Chapter: Chapter XII A TRAITOR AMONGST US
Speaker: Gavin
Text: Aw come on you, pick it up! We’d about given up the ghost there didn’t we? Fancy another round?

Chapter: Chapter XII A TRAITOR AMONGST US
Speaker: Lord Chancellor
Text: Surrender yourself! No one may escape the penalty!

Chapter: Chapter XII A TRAITOR AMONGST US
Speaker: Galahad
Text: You forget Lord Chancellor, I’m as good as dead already.
[Some man and Tesla take a boat ride to where Galahad jumped. The man wearing a cape - apparently he want to stay incognito.]

Speaker: Man
Text: Gently, my friend.

Speaker: Tesla
Text: Will he survive?

Speaker: Man
Text: That is for him to decide.
[Galahad is brought into a house and placed on a bed.]

Speaker: Tesla
Text: Two days! It has already been two days! We cannot leave him here like this!

Speaker: Man
Text: I have done what I can. It is not for me to protect him now. I will call upon him if he lives through this ordeal.

Speaker: Tesla
Text: My friend, my friend! You must stay with us! Sir Galahad! Sir Galahad!

Speaker: Tesla
Text: Here, Lady Lakshmi.

Speaker: Rani
Text: You were right to bring me here, Nikola.

Speaker: Tesla
Text: There’s not much more I can do. All of London is looking for him.

Speaker: Rani
Text: So they are. We will take care of him. Time will tell if he will make it through.

Speaker: Rani
Text: Do not be a fool, Nikola!

Speaker: Tesla
Text: I do not have a choice. If I am gone too long they will suspect something.

Speaker: Rani
Text: What if they already know? You have helped enough. Let us handle matters from now on.

Speaker: Tesla
Text: There is still so much for me to do, Lady Lakshmi. Please, take care of him. I fear that without him, we do not stand a chance.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Lakshmi…

Speaker: Rani
Text: Well, knight. You are not one to give up so easily.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Where am I?

Speaker: Rani
Text: You’re at a safe house on the embankment. You’ve been in and out of consciousness for almost a fortnight. But, come, we must make our way back to Whitechapel. The authorities are searching for you everywhere.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: How did you find me?

Speaker: Rani
Text: You must thank Nikola. He brought you here and sought my help.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Nikola… How do you know Nikola?

Speaker: Rani
Text: I will let him explain his involvement in our affairs. Nikola left you these. He thought you would appreciate them.
[There’s a uniform and some weapons on the table. It’s hard to say, but I’ll assume they belonged to Sir Perceval. Galahad gears up.]

Speaker: Rani
Text: Come. Let’s go.

Chapter: Chapter XIV A KNIGHT OF OLD
Speaker: Galahad
Text: Lakshmi… The Blackwater, how did you come about it?

Chapter: Chapter XIV A KNIGHT OF OLD
Speaker: Rani
Text: It was bestowed on me.

Chapter: Chapter XIV A KNIGHT OF OLD
Speaker: Galahad
Text: You mean to say - a knight?

Chapter: Chapter XIV A KNIGHT OF OLD
Speaker: Rani
Text: Sir Bors de Ganis.

Chapter: Chapter XIV A KNIGHT OF OLD
Speaker: Galahad
Text: Sir Bors has not been seen since the search for the Grail. You say he lives? In East India?

Chapter: Chapter XIV A KNIGHT OF OLD
Speaker: Rani
Text: I did not say he lived, Knight.

Chapter: Chapter XIV A KNIGHT OF OLD
Speaker: Soldier
Text: Keep your eyes open lads, the fugitive could be armed.

Chapter: Chapter XIV A KNIGHT OF OLD
Speaker: Rani
Text: Company patrol… Just what I was worried about…

Chapter: Chapter XIV A KNIGHT OF OLD
Speaker: Soldier
Text: What the… shoot them! They’ve split, they’re moving up both tunnels!

Chapter: Chapter XIV A KNIGHT OF OLD
Speaker: Rani
Text: More guards, coming down the left tunnel!

Chapter: Chapter XIV A KNIGHT OF OLD
Speaker: Galahad
Text: Clear… but more are bound to head this way.

Chapter: Chapter XIV A KNIGHT OF OLD
Speaker: Rani
Text: Agreed. Stay ready.

Chapter: Chapter XIV A KNIGHT OF OLD
Speaker: Soldier
Text: The shots are coming from down here; fingers on your triggers lads! There! Take them down!

Chapter: Chapter XIV A KNIGHT OF OLD
Speaker: Rani
Text: That’s the last of them. We should keep moving before more arrive.

Chapter: Chapter XIV A KNIGHT OF OLD
Speaker: Galahad
Text: Lead the way.

Chapter: Chapter XIV A KNIGHT OF OLD
Speaker: Rani
Text: Whitechapel is this way.

Chapter: Chapter XIV A KNIGHT OF OLD
Text: [Meanwhile, Lady Igraine enters the room where Galahad was lying with a soldier. She breathes like a rhinoceros, apparently trying to smell Galahad.]

Chapter: Chapter XIV A KNIGHT OF OLD
Speaker: Soldier
Text: Lady Igraine, there is evidence of a few people having been here. Sir Galahad must have had help.

Chapter: Chapter XIV A KNIGHT OF OLD
Speaker: Igraine
Text: Get word to the Council that we have tracked the convict! Tell every able knight to converge towards Whitechapel.

Chapter: Chapter XIV A KNIGHT OF OLD
Speaker: Soldier
Text: Yes, My Lady!

Chapter: Chapter XIV A KNIGHT OF OLD
Speaker: Igraine
Text: God be my witness, I will see to the end of the Rebellion.

Chapter: Chapter XIV A KNIGHT OF OLD
Text: [Aux Belles Muses.]

Chapter: Chapter XIV A KNIGHT OF OLD
Speaker: Rani
Text: Everyone! Leave! Now! We need to leave. It is only a matter of time until the authorities raid Whitechapel and make prisoners of every man and woman.

Chapter: Chapter XIV A KNIGHT OF OLD
Speaker: Galahad
Text: Salvage what you can and go. I have unfinished business at the Palace…

Chapter: Chapter XIV A KNIGHT OF OLD
Speaker: Rani
Text: Have you lost your senses? The palace is the last place you should show yourself.

Chapter: Chapter XIV A KNIGHT OF OLD
Speaker: Galahad
Text: I have to get Nikola out of there. I owe him that much.

Chapter: Chapter XIV A KNIGHT OF OLD
Speaker: Rani
Text: Alastair knows you. He’ll expect you to come.

Chapter: Chapter XIV A KNIGHT OF OLD
Speaker: Galahad
Text: I know.

Chapter: Chapter XIV A KNIGHT OF OLD
Speaker: Rani
Text: Then we will go together.

Chapter: Chapter XIV A KNIGHT OF OLD
Speaker: Galahad
Text: No. This is a fight that I must see through alone. If I live to see tomorrow, I shall find you.

Chapter: Chapter XIV A KNIGHT OF OLD
Speaker: Rani
Text: So be it, Knight.

Chapter: Chapter XIV A KNIGHT OF OLD
Speaker: Galahad
Text: Do you not know? I am a knight no longer.

Chapter: Chapter XIV A KNIGHT OF OLD
Text: [He goes down to the first floor of the brothel.]

Chapter: Chapter XIV A KNIGHT OF OLD
Speaker: Lafayette
Text: A knight, you are not, Monsieur. But are you a turncoat or a patriot?

Chapter: Chapter XIV A KNIGHT OF OLD
Speaker: Galahad
Text: What would you have me be, Marquis?

Chapter: Chapter XIV A KNIGHT OF OLD
Speaker: Lafayette
Text: I believe you have reason for what you do. Two revolutions have taught Lafayette that there are dangers on both sides.

Chapter: Chapter XIV A KNIGHT OF OLD
Speaker: Galahad
Text: I will not forget this, Marquis.

Chapter: Chapter XIV A KNIGHT OF OLD
Speaker: Lafayette
Text: See that you do not, monsieur. Should you threaten the cause of liberty, you can count on Lafayette to be your sworn enemy.  Goodbye, sir.  Until we meet again.

Chapter: Chapter XIV A KNIGHT OF OLD
Speaker: Galahad
Text: That we will, my friend.

Chapter: Chapter XV TO SAVE A LIFE
Speaker: Devi
Text: Leaving us so soon?

Chapter: Chapter XV TO SAVE A LIFE
Speaker: Galahad
Text: Devi.

Chapter: Chapter XV TO SAVE A LIFE
Speaker: Devi
Text: So, you do remember my name.

Chapter: Chapter XV TO SAVE A LIFE
Speaker: Galahad
Text: There is much I should explain to you. I should have trusted you long ago.

Chapter: Chapter XV TO SAVE A LIFE
Speaker: Devi
Text: There’s no time for pleasantries. It seems you are eager to get yourself killed.

Chapter: Chapter XV TO SAVE A LIFE
Speaker: Galahad
Text: I must make this right. Whatever the cost.

Chapter: Chapter XV TO SAVE A LIFE
Speaker: Devi
Text: Then take this.  Oh, and do come back in one piece. It seems my queen has taken a liking to you.

Chapter: Chapter XV TO SAVE A LIFE
Text: [She leaves.]

Chapter: Chapter XV TO SAVE A LIFE
Speaker: Galahad
Text: Nikola, come in. I’m in the catacombs, on my way to you.

Chapter: Chapter XV TO SAVE A LIFE
Speaker: Tesla
Text: Sir Galahad, are you mad? You must not come this way.

Chapter: Chapter XV TO SAVE A LIFE
Speaker: Galahad
Text: Stay put. I’ll be there shortly.

Chapter: Chapter XV TO SAVE A LIFE
Text: [He enters the catacombs.]

Chapter: Chapter XV TO SAVE A LIFE
Speaker: Soldier 1
Text: Did you hear that?

Chapter: Chapter XV TO SAVE A LIFE
Speaker: Soldier 2
Text: Aye, we best investigate.

Chapter: Chapter XV TO SAVE A LIFE
Speaker: Galahad
Text: Damn…

Chapter: Chapter XV TO SAVE A LIFE
Speaker: Soldier
Text: The gunfire was coming from that tunnel… stand ready. Armed intruder! Open fire!

Chapter: Chapter XV TO SAVE A LIFE
Speaker: Tesla
Text: Sir Galahad, we may have a complication. Sir Lacan is on his way.

Chapter: Chapter XV TO SAVE A LIFE
Speaker: Galahad
Text: Nikola, you need to get out of there now!

Chapter: Chapter XV TO SAVE A LIFE
Speaker: Tesla
Text: There is nothing to fear, my friend. I will keep communication open on my side. It will be alright.

Chapter: Chapter XV TO SAVE A LIFE
Speaker: Galahad
Text: Nikola, don’t be a fool! Nikola! Damn!

Chapter: Chapter XV TO SAVE A LIFE
Speaker: Soldier
Text: Sir Galahad stand down!

Chapter: Chapter XV TO SAVE A LIFE
Speaker: Soldier 1
Text: Don’t worry lads, I’ll handle this!

Chapter: Chapter XV TO SAVE A LIFE
Speaker: Soldier 2
Text: He’s here.

Chapter: Chapter XV TO SAVE A LIFE
Speaker: Galahad
Text: Shit!

Chapter: Chapter XV TO SAVE A LIFE
Speaker: Soldier 1
Text: Fire at will! Watch it! He’s got a ruddy arc gun!

Chapter: Chapter XV TO SAVE A LIFE
Speaker: Soldier 3
Text: Reinforcements are here, lads! Do not let him through!

Chapter: Chapter XV TO SAVE A LIFE
Speaker: Soldier 2
Text: Look out! Thermite!

Chapter: Chapter XV TO SAVE A LIFE
Speaker: Soldier 1
Text: He’s moving down the side! Don’t let him flank us!

Chapter: Chapter XV TO SAVE A LIFE
Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Nikola, just the man I wanted to see.

Chapter: Chapter XV TO SAVE A LIFE
Speaker: Tesla
Text: How may I help you, Sir Lucan.

Chapter: Chapter XV TO SAVE A LIFE
Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Come with me. We have much to discuss.

Chapter: Chapter XV TO SAVE A LIFE
Speaker: Tesla
Text: Yes sir.

Chapter: Chapter XV TO SAVE A LIFE
Speaker: Galahad
Text: Damn you Alastair…

Chapter: Chapter XV TO SAVE A LIFE
Text: [Tesla Laboratory. Tesla sits on the floor, leaning his back against the wall. He’s got a gun in his hands.]

Chapter: Chapter XV TO SAVE A LIFE
Speaker: Galahad
Text: Nikola. What happened?

Chapter: Chapter XV TO SAVE A LIFE
Speaker: Tesla
Text: Lady Lakshmi was right. He knew.

Chapter: Chapter XV TO SAVE A LIFE
Speaker: Galahad
Text: I’ll get you out of here.

Chapter: Chapter XV TO SAVE A LIFE
Speaker: Tesla
Text: He’s still in there. It’s too late. There is nothing we can do.

Chapter: Chapter XV TO SAVE A LIFE
Speaker: Galahad
Text: There’s still something I must do.

Chapter: Chapter XVI BROTHER, LET US EMBRACE
Speaker: Galahad
Text: Alastair!

Chapter: Chapter XVI BROTHER, LET US EMBRACE
Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: I knew you would return, brother.

Chapter: Chapter XVI BROTHER, LET US EMBRACE
Speaker: Galahad
Text: Come out of the shadows, damn you!!

Chapter: Chapter XVI BROTHER, LET US EMBRACE
Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: You and I, we are not that different. I do what I must, to protect my kind. We fight only for our right to live.

Chapter: Chapter XVI BROTHER, LET US EMBRACE
Speaker: Galahad
Text: That’s a lie!

Chapter: Chapter XVI BROTHER, LET US EMBRACE
Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: One day, perhaps, you will understand. Forgive me, Grayson. This is not the outcome I sought.

Chapter: Chapter XVI BROTHER, LET US EMBRACE
Text: [They start fighting on knives.]

Chapter: Chapter XVI BROTHER, LET US EMBRACE
Speaker: Galahad
Text: Show your true self.

Chapter: Chapter XVI BROTHER, LET US EMBRACE
Text: [Sir Lucan transforms into Lycan.]

Chapter: Chapter XVI BROTHER, LET US EMBRACE
Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Have you had enough?

Chapter: Chapter XVI BROTHER, LET US EMBRACE
Text: [A cruel battle begins, an immortal knight against an immortal beast. Having received many wounds from Galahad’s knife, Sir Lucan is transformed back into a man.]

Chapter: Chapter XVI BROTHER, LET US EMBRACE
Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: I have lived too long to not to know this day would come.

Chapter: Chapter XVI BROTHER, LET US EMBRACE
Speaker: Galahad
Text: Why, Alastair? You have fought at our side all these years.

Chapter: Chapter XVI BROTHER, LET US EMBRACE
Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: I have seen things I am condemned to remember. Civilizations born and destroyed by humanity’s incessant greed. The pride of men slaughtering each other in the name of their so-called God.

Chapter: Chapter XVI BROTHER, LET US EMBRACE
Speaker: Galahad
Text: We will atone for our sins in time. But how can you justify the atrocities your kind have committed?

Chapter: Chapter XVI BROTHER, LET US EMBRACE
Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: "My kind." My kind are no more evil than yours.

Chapter: Chapter XVI BROTHER, LET US EMBRACE
Speaker: Galahad
Text: What of your sister? Was it all a lie?

Chapter: Chapter XVI BROTHER, LET US EMBRACE
Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Isi, my Father - I loved them as my own blood, but they could not begin to know the curse I have lived with.

Chapter: Chapter XVI BROTHER, LET US EMBRACE
Speaker: Lord Chancellor
Text: My son.

Chapter: Chapter XVI BROTHER, LET US EMBRACE
Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: Father, forgive me.

Chapter: Chapter XVI BROTHER, LET US EMBRACE
Speaker: Lord Chancellor
Text: It is I who needs your forgiveness. I never meant this life for you.

Chapter: Chapter XVI BROTHER, LET US EMBRACE
Speaker: Galahad
Text: You knew?

Chapter: Chapter XVI BROTHER, LET US EMBRACE
Speaker: Lord Chancellor
Text: I have always known. I rescued him from the massacre of his family. Your father died by my sword. But – a child? You didn’t deserve such a fate. How could I have taken the life of an innocent?

Chapter: Chapter XVI BROTHER, LET US EMBRACE
Speaker: Galahad
Text: Confess this to the council, Lord Chancellor. It is the only way to make amends for the havoc that has been unleashed.

Chapter: Chapter XVI BROTHER, LET US EMBRACE
Speaker: Lord Chancellor
Text: I cannot. The revelation would shake our Order to its very foundations.

Chapter: Chapter XVI BROTHER, LET US EMBRACE
Speaker: Galahad
Text: So I am to be sacrificed. How many more must die to insure an eternal silence?

Chapter: Chapter XVI BROTHER, LET US EMBRACE
Speaker: Lord Chancellor
Text: He is my son. I cannot be the one to end his life. Isabeau and the Council must never discover the truth lest all you hold dear perish.

Chapter: Chapter XVI BROTHER, LET US EMBRACE
Text: [He gives Galahad his gun.]

Chapter: Chapter XVI BROTHER, LET US EMBRACE
Speaker: Galahad
Text: Do not ask this of me.

Chapter: Chapter XVI BROTHER, LET US EMBRACE
Speaker: Lord Chancellor
Text: Henceforth, you shall have fellowship with no knights. The Order must remain united. You are no longer one of its heralds. Finish what you have begun and vanish.

Chapter: Chapter XVI BROTHER, LET US EMBRACE
Text: [He turns around and goes to the exit.]

Chapter: Chapter XVI BROTHER, LET US EMBRACE
Speaker: Lord Chancellor
Text: Men were never meant to live this life.

Chapter: Chapter XVI BROTHER, LET US EMBRACE
Text: [Galahad stands submerged in thought with a gun in his hand.]

Chapter: Chapter XVI BROTHER, LET US EMBRACE
Speaker: Sir Lucan
Text: There shall come a day when all our burdens will end, brother. Maybe then we shall know true peace.

Chapter: Chapter XVI BROTHER, LET US EMBRACE
Text: [Galahad cocks the gun… raises his hand… and shoots.]
[Galahad stands on the roof of the building, watching the night city.]

Speaker: Tesla
Text: Sir Galahad. The whole of London is looking for you. We mustn’t delay! Sir Galahad! Can you hear me? Sir Galahad!

Speaker: Galahad
Text: Be at ease Nikola. All is fine.

Speaker: Tesla
Text: So you say my friend… The council has declared Martial Law throughout the city. There is no telling when the authorities will decide to mount an offensive. Now is not the time for heroics. I would advise we follow Lady Lakshmi’s lead and leave the city.

Speaker: Galahad
Text: I’ll join you shortly. And don’t you know… I’m Galahad no more…
